Title: Environmental Works - Responsive Repairs & Void Properties
Description:
Unitas are looking to appoint two contractors to carry out environmental works for the responsive repairs and void properties section of the business. The works include but are not limited to fencing, drainage works, works to boundary works and other general brickwork items. 
The works will be allocated using the cascading method, which means that the contractor who is in first place following the tender evaluation will get all available works until they are at full capacity, then the contractor in second place will be utilised. 
This opportunity will be evaluated based on MEAT and the split is 60% price, 15% technical and 25% CSR (corporate social responsibility). 
The contract period will be for 4 years commencing in April 2023.
Full details are available via Pro Contract tendering portal.

NELFT, BEH and C&I Procurement Shared Service requests offers for the provision of the above goods based on a fixed 12 month offer, for one or more orders, quantities may vary.

Please clearly state your offered product's unit of measure and ensure you accompany your offer with a per item price.
Offers for alternative products should be clearly stated, and any relevant specifications and information should accompany those variant offers.
No carriage charges should be included or subsequently billed.
The Trust does not bind itself to accept any offer, either in whole or in part. Your offer must be issued in accordance with the appropriate NHS Conditions of Contract, a copy of which is available on the Department of Health Website at: http://www.dh.gov.uk/en/publicationsandstatistics/publications/publicationspolicyandguidance/dh_121260

Not registered on MultiQuote - visit https://suppliers.multiquote.com then register and quote RA284407 as the reason for registration. Any queries please contact MultiQuote on 0151 482 9230.

Title: GB-Basildon: Collection & Processing of Treated Wood
Description: Basildon Council requires a contractor to either provide an open topped container suitable for public use, or subject to operational proximity to Barleylands Depot, to allow for direct delivery using containers provided by Basildon Council, for the collection/deliver of mixed household wood to be accepted for recycling. It is expected that all wood that is collected has the waste management hierarchy applied to this, with recycling the preferred method. Should the material not be suitable for recycling then it may be process  other methods (such as Biomass).
Additional Text: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.

Title: Market Engagement Event - Provision of Integrated Lifestyle Services
Description:
Haringey Council is informing potential providers about a market engagement event on the forthcoming procurement for the Provision of Integrated Lifestyle services. 

PLEASE NOTE this is not a call for competition or formal tendering procedure.

The event will enable providers to get information about the council's commissioning intentions and forthcoming procurement and provide feedback before the start of the procurement.                        

The Market Engagement Event will take place via MS teams on 1st July 2020 from 14.30 hrs to 16.30hrs. 

The council wishes to commission an organisation(s) to deliver an Integrated lifestyle service which includes: 

â€¢	Smoking Cessation
â€¢	Adult weight management
â€¢	Physical activity sessions
â€¢	Community based NHS Health Checks 
â€¢	Brief alcohol advice

It is anticipated that the tender will start in mid July 2020 with 8 weeks' response time. The service would commence on 1st April 2021 and run for a period of up to 8 years with a break clause after the initial 3 years. 

We are keen to engage with the provider market regarding our commissioning intentions therefore we would be grateful if you would complete and return the market engagement questionnaire available via:

https://s2c.waxdigital.co.uk/ProcurementLBHaringey/DisplayModules/TradeModules/Negotiations/Opportunities/ListEvents.aspx?ApplicationInstanceID=27adc89e-0cb2-4b51-9bc1-34061f10156f

Please return your response to the market engagement questionnaire and confirm your organisation's interest in attending the event before 5pm on 15th June 2020.  

For all attendees please provide us with names and email addresses. Invitations will then be sent to all interested suppliers during week commencing 22nd June 2020.

Places are limited to 2 persons per organisation.

Title: Integrated Social Care & Finance Case Management System
Description:
A fully integrated Software As A Service (SAAS) Adults, Children's, Early Help and Finance Social Care Case Management System (the System). The System must provide the ability to manage the cases of all Adults & Children's Social Care work and Early Help Services and meet all relevant statutory requirements.

The initial contract term is 5 years. The Council shall have the option to further extend the contract term on the same terms for a further period or periods of not less than 12 months, up to a maximum overall extension period of 10 years.

Title: Upgrade of the Electrical Systems at Chestnut House, Oak House and Rowen House, The Groves, Bishport Ave, Hartcliffe, Bristol, BS13 0RS (Rewires)
Description:
The works described in this Specification shall comprise the following Electrical Services associated with Chestnut House, Oak House and Rowan Houses.
o	Incoming Electricity Supply and main panel to new location (currently generator room).

o	Builder works and making good.

o	Removal of generator, associated switch gear and cabling.

o	Distribution Installation and distribution boards.

o	Building Sub-main cabling.

o	Installation of LED dimmable lighting.

o	Installation of LED emergency (dimmable in normal state) lighting. 

o	Rewire of ALL lighting and power final circuits.

o	Installation of LED street lighting to carpark.

o	Earthing and bonding.

o	TV Trunking upgrade.

o	Testing and commissioning.

o	"As Fitted" drawings and maintenance manual.

o	Removal of the any redundant electrical equipment, containment and cabling found during   
            these works.
To participate in this tendering opportunity register your company onto https://procontract.due-north.com/ and search for DN377013. Site visits are mandatory and must be carried out prior to submitting a bid.

Title: Gasworks Pipe Bridge - Refurbishment
Description:
This Invitation to Tender (and the associated draft Contract and documents) (ITT) relates to the procurement of refurbishment works to the Gasworks Pipe Bridge. 

The Isis Gasworks Footbridge (also known as the Gasworks Pipe Bridge) crosses the river Thames between Friars Wharf and Baltic Wharf, Oxford (Eastings:451134 Northings: 205625). 

Please note that this bridge was built in 1927 by Head Wrightson & Co. Ltd to carry pipes across the River Thames. 

The structure was modified in the 1970s to accommodate a public footpath with stairs - on the north side only - and ramps on either side.

In summary (details of the works required is included in our Specification, attached to this ITT) the scope of works includes:
A.	The repair and strengthening services for the deteriorated steelwork throughout the Bridge;
B.	The removal and safe disposal of existing concrete deck planks including of the supporting steel angles and the installation of new fibre reinforced polymer deck panels 
C.	the removal of dilapidated painting and repainting;
D.	The repairs or replacement of the existing bridge parapet;
E.	The repair of the bridge abutments. 
F.	The installation of Lockable access doors to the rooms behind the existing bridge abutments
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [B & M McHugh Ltd|SE9 3UL|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: International Consultancy DPS
Description:
Energy Systems Catapult have set up a DPS for working internationally to enable ESC to continue its work accelerating energy systems around the world, as well as in the UK. The DPS is intended to provide a centralised platform to enable ESCs reach to expand and to be able to procure services for projects based outside of the U.K. 

Currently the ESC is working in India on a range of activities, to showcase UK clean energy innovation and expertise. Currently the focus is primarily on the Innovating for Transport and Energy Systems (ITES) initiative. ITES is a collaboration between leading research organisations from India and the UK to address the obstacles to action on decarbonising transport and energy systems. In addition to ITES, it is expected that ESC will do additional projects on energy systems in India. In order to better deliver projects in India and to maximise impact, ESC is looking to collaborate with Indian partners and is therefore establishing this DPS.

ESC hopes to have more projects in the future based in other countries, at which time further Lot(s) may be added to this DPS.

Lots:

LOT 1 - Indian Energy Systems Activity Support

Sub Lots:
1.1	- Identifying and mapping stakeholders, activities and initiatives
1.2	- Stakeholder engagement and networking
1.3	- Research and identifying challenges and opportunities in transport and energy sectors
1.4	- Pilot development and support
1.5	- Funding, sponsorship and investment
1.6	- Dissemination, events, communications & branding
1.6.1 - Event support
1.6.2 - Strategic support for dissemination & branding, dissemination campaigns
1.6.3 - Development of dissemination outputs
1.6.4 - Diagnosis support
1.7	- Support to innovators and incubators

To apply you must request an application pack by emailing: procurement@es.catapult.org.uk
Contact Address 1: 7Th Floor, Cannon House,18 The Priory Queensway
Additional Text: To apply you must request an application pack by emailing: procurement@es.catapult.org.uk
Additional Details: To apply you must request an application pack by emailing: procurement@es.catapult.org.uk

Title: 639 - Fire Line Improvements Main Building & Outbuildings
Description:
Aston University is seeking to improve its building fire lines to reduce the risk of the uncontrolled spread of smoke and fire throughout our buildings, leading to an increased risk of danger to life and building integrity during a fire.

As a result, Aston University is seeking an experienced and accredited contractor to undertake the following Fire Lining improvements: 

â€¢	Fire Stopping Works - to include All conventional fire stopping works i.e., 'Batt and mastic' fire stopping, Fire Stop foam, Intumescent colours, and bandages etc,
â€¢	Fire Damper Works - Installation of mode 5 or fusible link dampers within in-use ductwork passing through fire compartments.
â€¢	Fire Door Works - Rectification of fire door gaps & rectification of poorly fitted fire door frames to structure i.e., replacement of 'pink expanding foam'. 

to the following buildings of the University:

-	Main Building 
-	Aston Day Hospital (ADH)
-	Aston Brain Centre (ACS) 
-	Nursery
-	Vision Science (VS)
-	Woodcock Sports Centre (WSC)
-	Walsall Recreation Centre 
-	EBRI

For the improvements that have been identified there will be a pricing schedule with a description of the work with a measure of metre run, area, etc. 

Additional works that are identified as the project progresses will be prorated against the contractors priced schedule. If there is any work that cannot be prorated, then a rate will be agreed between both parties.  These additional works may be subject to re measure.    

These improvements to be undertaken in accordance with Aston Design Guidelines; Passive Fire Protection v10. 

It is intended that this scheme will be funded solely by Aston University.

Title: Carers Support Services
Description:
This procurement is being conducted in accordance with the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.  The procurement is subject to the light-touch regime under Section 7 Social and Other Specific Services.  Under Regulation 76 the Council is free to establish a procedure, provided that procedure is sufficient to ensure compliance with the principles of transparency and equal treatment of economic operators (service providers).

Newham's Carers Strategy sets out a single, ambitious approach to improving the identification of and support to Carers across the borough at scale. The Council and its partners are looking for an experienced and innovative provider (or providers) to deliver Strengths-Based and highly accessible Carers support services and to drive forward the Carers Strategy outcomes. The service is divided into lots: 

Lot 1) An online / virtual Carers Support service to provide comprehensive support to Adult Carers aged 18+ online and with the preferred addition of a telephone support option.
Lot 2) A Locally embedded all age-service (Young Carers, Parent Carers, Adult Carers) which will work with local Carers groups,Schools, Health providers, VCS and across our community as a whole to identify Carers, deliver direct support and enable them to navigate the range of local services that they need.
Suppliers will be able to apply for one or more lots, for example, Lot 1 only, Lot 2 only or both Lots 1 and 2.

The new service contract will go live on 1 April 2023 and will run for three years (with the option to extend on a two + two year basis, subject to satisfactory performance).

Total value for 7 years of contract is Â£1,785,000.00 excluding VAT divided in lots as per below: 
Lot 1= Â£350,000 (50K pa)
Lot 2 = Â£1,435,000 (205K pa)

Title: 22043 - Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) and Peterborough City Council (PCC) Target Hardening Scheme
Description:
The Domestic Abuse Act 2021 has implemented a statutory requirement on Local Authorities to ensure there is safe accommodation for victims of domestic abuse. Both Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) and Peterborough City Council (PCC) are seeking a provider to help support the victims of domestic abuse to improve security in their home and increase their safety - this includes the changing of locks, fitting window locks, video doorbells and providing safety advice.

This is a 12 month contract with options to extend by two additional 12 month periods (12+12+12) which would result in a possible total contract duration of 36 months.

Title: Barrow-in-Furness Leisure Centre LED Replacement
Description:
Barrow Borough Council is seeking to replace the existing lighting at Barrow Park Leisure Centre, Greengate Street, Barrow in Furness. Cumbria LA13 9DT The existing lighting is of various types, set out in Schedule 1. A schematic plan of the Centre is shown on Schedule 2

The Council is seeking to replace the existing lighting with energy saving LED lights through a funded programme "Low Carbon Barrow".

The specification requirement is to align with the current fixtures however, this is not prescriptive, and alternative fittings of a similar or higher standard would be acceptable. A redesign of the arrays may also be considered, functionality must be maintained.

Tenderers should be aware that the Leisure Centre is an operational venue, and works will need to be co-ordinated around events taking place.

All Tender documents are available at the following link - Please ensure all correspondence is conducted via the Chest. https://procontract.due-north.com/Procurer/Advert/View?advertId=a54d7287-9471-ed11-811c-005056b64545&fromAdvertEvent=True

Title: PLACE059 Passenger Transport DPS Pre-Launch Consultation
Description:
Derbyshire County Council (DCC, the Council) have developed a new 5 lot Dynamic Purchasing System (DPS) to replace the current 3 DPS's for all long-term passenger transport needs. This DPS shall provide transport commissioned by the Council to meet all eligible passenger's needs, its statutory duties and strategic planning for transport services. This DPS shall provide the Council with a procurement mechanism to tender its transport requirements within Derbyshire and for journeys/services which may commence, or end, outside of the county.

As part of the development of this DPS, the Council wishes to consult with both its Operator base and the wider market on the proposed DPS documentation to ensure a smooth transition process from the current DPS, to this new DPS which is scheduled to go live in December 2022.

In order to respond to the Market Consultation, Operators should follow this link >> https://forms.office.com/r/RK1JUiCMNN

This DPS shall provide the Council with a procurement mechanism to tender its transport requirements within Derbyshire and for journeys/services which may commence, or end, outside of the county.

As part of the development of this DPS, the Council wishes to consult with both its Operator base and the wider market on the proposed DPS documentation to ensure a smooth transition process from the current DPS, to this new DPS which is scheduled to go live in December 2022.

Title: TfGM - Leigh and Bolton Bus Stations - Redecorations
Description:
This notice relates to the competition to award a deep clean and re-decoration Contract at Leigh Bus Station and Bolton Interchange to a single Supplier.

SITE VISIT UPDATE - The date for the site visit in the tender document is incorrect. The visits will be held on Monday 30/05 and Tuesday 31/05. Please still contact the TfGM representative mentioned in the tender document to arrange this. Apologies for any confusion caused.

Leigh Bus Station
The contract involves the full Internal and external deep clean and preparation for redecoration of the internal and external bus stands at Leigh Bus station (All deep cleaning is out of Hours)
The contractor is to ensure all electrical sensitive equipment is protected in both internal and external deep cleans and during the course of the redecoration works 
The full Internal and external redecoration on a phased programme of the internal and external bus stands at Leigh Bus station A to L 
Preparation, cleaning, and redecoration of identified elements of the exterior of the TfGM office accommodation building 
Making good any defective surfaces to any plaster work to the areas to be painted

Bolton Interchange
Preparation, cleaning, and redecoration at high level on a phased programme of the concourse pre-painted plasterboard bulkheads, perimeter soffits and internal columns at Bolton Great moor St Interchange out of hours (over night).
Making good any defective surfaces to any plaster work to the areas to be painted

Suppliers interested in bidding for this opportunity should register on TfGM's e-tendering solution, Pro-Contract (https://procontract.due-north.com/Home/About), and search for the below opportunity:

Reference Number: DN614138

Title: Digital Progression - Hospitality and Tourism
Description:
West Yorkshire Consortium of Colleges (WYCC) are seeking partners to deliver a programme of digital skills training to individuals within the Hospitality and Tourism sector. This tender is part funded by the European Social Fund.
      
      This commission forms an element of the Digital Progression component of WYCC's Reach Higher project. 
      
      The training can be directed towards employed individuals to support their career progression, as well as students to support their education. 
      
      In summary, the services being tendered cover: 
      
      (a) Employer engagement and recruitment of individuals to undertake training; 
      
      (b) Development of training and delivery; and 
      
      (c) Evaluation of the training provision and lessons learned report.
      
      Successful applicants would be expected to commence delivery March 2019, with delivery complete by June 2019.

Please refer to the Commission Brief and accompanying Application Documents

Title: 9116 List Condition and Engagement Project Phase 2  North West and North East & Yorkshire - AWARD
Description:
Historic England is seeking to engage with community groups and organisations (and through them a wider pool of volunteers) based in, or working within, the areas or Local Authority Districts of Blackpool, Whitby (Scarborough), Maryport (Allerdale), Barrow-in-Furness or Whitehaven (Copeland), on an important piece of work which we are undertaking.  
      
      The project aims are to support ongoing work to improve engagement opportunities with the National Heritage List for England (NHLE) which is more commonly known as the List. In 2021-22, three pilot projects undertaken with external partners, such as civic or amenity societies, assessed the condition of the List in three selected areas. 
      
      As well as helping us to improve our understanding of issues and limitations with the information contained within the List, this second phase of projects will help more people and communities connect with, and better understand, the extent and value of their local heritage. The work will help familiarise you and your team of volunteers with the regimes in place to help protect and promote this heritage, while giving you closer involvement with the designated heritage of your own area.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Cumbria County History Trust|24, Pennine Way, PENRITH, Cumbria, United Kingdom, CA11 8EE|NONE||No|No]

      The project aims are to support ongoing work to improve engagement opportunities with the National Heritage List for England (NHLE) which is more commonly known as the List. The work will help familiarise you and your team of volunteers with the regimes in place to help protect and promote this heritage, while giving you closer involvement with the designated heritage of your own area.

Title: UKRI-1597 Public Engagement Procurement - Gaming
Description: UKRI is sponsored by the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy and supports activities and events that inspire and engage people and promote positive climate action. Gamification is one approach to increasing public engagement with climate research and we are keen to explore the ways in which it provides a way of reaching audiences who are currently less engaged with research and innovation, specifically on the themes of COP26. UKRI is seeking a supplier who are able to design and oversee the successful delivery of a national gaming or game making public engagement programme that increases public engagement with COP26 themed research amongst specific identified communities, including but not limited to: climate change and nature based solutions to reaching net zero, adaptation and resilience, and clean transport UKRI will be holding a supplier day via zoom on 9th September 2021,commencing at 10:30 BST - more details available in II.2.14 Additional Information

Title: Landscaping and Groundworks
Description:
Services Required
We are looking to appoint a contractor that will have the skills and abilities to create a design and construct a garden that fulfils our objectives. The contractor we are looking to appoint must be able to demonstrate.

â€¢	References from customers where they have completed similar works.
â€¢	Details of relevant insurance cover for this type of project.
â€¢	Health and Safety documentation that include sample risk and method statements.

The attached images and dimensions supplied within this ITQ are for reference only. It is essential that contractors visit site and be responsible for their measurements of the area before submitting a quote. The Hospice will invite all interested parties to the site on the morning of Wednesday 28 April 2023. No alternate site visits are planned or allowed within this procurement exercise.

The key objectives of this project are.

â€¢	The view to the gardens from the patient rooms should be stimulating in both colour of planting and floral aroma that is viable within each season.
â€¢	Features added to the garden that encourage wildlife and insects.
â€¢	Create a peaceful environment.
â€¢	Create spaces that allow the patients (in wheelchairs or beds) to use external spaces with their families and friends for quiet enjoyment giving consideration to privacy from neighbouring rooms. 
â€¢	Create a collective area centrally to the garden that can be accessed from each room.
â€¢	Provide viable protection from the sun or rain through fixed or furniture provision.
â€¢	Provide lighting features to subtly illuminate the garden during the hours of darkness.

It is essential that the following services and provisions are maintained and adhered to. 

â€¢	The existing walkway to the perimeter of the building must be maintained within your design.
â€¢	Maintaining level access from each bedroom through the existing patio windows.
â€¢	The existing central housing for the air conditioning equipment that is shielded by wooden fencing must be maintained (and enhanced where applicable).
â€¢	Proposed paths and walkways must be suitable to allow hospital beds to be pushed and manoeuvred within existing risk assessment requirements (attached). 
â€¢	Join seamlessly with the adjacent garden area to the rear of the Hospice grounds
Attachments: Garden ITQ Feb 23 V2.docx Tendor info V2.pdf

Title: Career Framework for the Nursing and Midwifery Educator Workforce - Health Education England
Description:
NHS Health Education England (HEE - the Commissioner) are commencing a tender to support the Career Framework for the Nursing and Midwifery Educator Workforce.

HEE are seeking a supplier to develop and deliver a Nurse and Midwifery Educators Career Framework. This work will include initial scoping of the issue, engagement with Subject Matter Experts in the form of regular Task and Finish Groups and the production of a final framework which will have been tested in engagement and feedback exercises to produce final version. We welcome evidence of having previously completed this type of work previously and evidence of collaborative engagement with SME's.

With the ability to reach across the Health and Social Care Education system in order to scope, establish and review the current pathways for Nursing and Midwifery educators is critical to this project and developed research skills will be essential.

This is an exciting opportunity to support Health Education England with this provision.

The maximum financial envelope for this procurement exercise is Â£90,000 inclusive of Vat. The contract period will be for eight (8) months, with an option to extend by a further four (4) months subject to review and available budget.

The deadline for submission of completed ITT submissions is 4th January 2023 at 12:00pm (midday). 

Late submissions will not be accepted therefore, please submit in good time prior to the deadline date and time. All communications should be made via the messaging function on the e-Tendering portal during the tender exercise.

The Contracting Authority requests that all communications are channelled through the e-portal system and not with the Contracting Authority itself other than as expressly permitted within this ITT. 

To express interest and access the Tender Documentation please use the link below and view live opportunities: (Project C117427)
https://health-family-contract-search.secure.force.com/?SearchType=Projects

Should Bidders have any queries, or are having problems using the portal, they should contact the Helpdesk on: Phone: 0800 9956035 or E-mail: support-health@atamis.co.uk

Title: Family Hubs Start for Life Parenting Peer Support Programme
Description: The Authority is inviting tenders from service providers with relevant experience and ability to demonstrate sufficient capacity to deliver a parent peer support programme. The programme aims to support high quality peer support provision coordinated across a local area to:  â€¢ Support new parents from pregnancy through to the infant being 2 years old â€¢ Promote positive early relationships and perinatal mental health support â€¢ Normalise and de-stigmatize conversations around mental health and parent-infant relationships difficulties that may occur â€¢ Support parents who may experience parental conflict in the first 1001 days â€¢ Provide emotional and peer support to ensure that families who may be experiencing mild to moderate mental health issues have a peer support network to turn to â€¢ Ensure fathers and partners have a bespoke support service addressing the specific emotional and mental health support needs they may be facing â€¢ Ensure marginalised communities such as the BAME community have specific support tailored to their needs â€¢ Work closely with the family hub networks, taking referrals for peer support and referring on when other needs emerge, as part of the Infant Mental Health Referral Pathway   The Authority requires Strategic Partners within the following 3 Lots:  The tender shall be split into 3 Lots, as detailed below, with one contract being awarded under Lot 1, two contracts being awarded under Lot 2 and one contract being awarded under Lot 3.     Lot 1 - Peer support model for dads or partners of the main carer of infants 0-2 years old Lot 2 - Peer support model for parents of infants 0-2 years old who may need support around emotional health and wellbeing and the parent-infant relationship Lot 3 - peer support model to support parents or carers who may have a child with an early identified SEND

Title: Football Foundation PlayZones Framework (Providers)
Description:
Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: II.2.3 Place of performance
        Instead of: UKK South West (England)
        Read: UKK South West (England) is covered under a previous procurement and does not sit within this procurement activity
        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement. Applicants should note that the estimated value of the Framework as set out in this Notice is based on the Contracting Authority's current anticipated requirements. UKK South West (England) has been removed from this procurement activity.
        The Contracting Authority is establishing a multiple provider framework to deliver small-sided, multi-use pitches. Providers will be required to design and build the small-sided pitch and all associated works to provide a playing surface for football and other sports.  The Contracting Authority will act as Funder for Applicants who will come from primarily public sector bodies such as local authorities, housing associations, schools and not for profit sports clubs. Works will be delivered adopting a two-stage design & build approach. The Contracting Authority is purchasing on behalf of itself and the entities listed at Section VI.

Title: The Provision of an Engagement Monitoring Software Solution
Description:
The University would like to be able to monitor the academic engagement of students, whilst partaking in academic activities on campus, off campus or academic activities whilst working online.
Monitoring academic engagement has also been introduced as part of the new immigration system on 5 October 2020 by the Home Office (UKVI). The new academic engagement policy requires sponsors (University of Southampton) to ensure that all sponsored students are academically engaged for the entirety of their course, including activities they consider would indicate academic engagement such as:
â€¢ Attending required lectures, seminars, or tutorials
â€¢ Undertaking required laboratory work
â€¢ Undertaking research or fieldwork
â€¢ Submitting essays, assignments and attending examinations
The monitoring needs to be simple for students to use and give visibility to the student of academic engagement information being collected. The university needs to be able collect the data required, use appropriate technology and to be able to report on the data quickly and efficiently.
Our plan is to have the appropriate, technological solution in place for September 2023.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [SEATS SOFTWARE LIMITED|111 MAIN STREET, BRAY, WICKLOW, A98E9N2, IRELAND|NONE_OTHER||Yes|Yes]
text:
The Provision of an Engagement Monitoring Software Solution The University would like to be able to monitor the academic engagement of students, whilst partaking in academic activities on campus, off campus or academic activities whilst working online.
Monitoring academic engagement has also been introduced as part of the new immigration system on 5 October 2020 by the Home Office (UKVI). The new academic engagement policy requires sponsors (University of Southampton) to ensure that all sponsored students are academically engaged for the entirety of their course, including activities they consider would indicate academic engagement such as:
â€¢ Attending required lectures, seminars, or tutorials
â€¢ Undertaking required laboratory work
â€¢ Undertaking research or fieldwork
â€¢ Submitting essays, assignments and attending examinations
The monitoring needs to be simple for students to use and give visibility to the student of academic engagement information being collected. The university needs to be able collect the data required, use appropriate technology and to be able to report on the data quickly and efficiently.
Our plan is to have the appropriate, technological solution in place for September 2023.

Title: NUN - Mobile Home Supply Concession Contract
Description:
Nuneaton and Bedworth Borough Council has recently completed groundworks to extend their Mobile Home Park on Bradestone Road, Nuneaton. This concession contract is for the supply and sale (inclusive of all marketing, sales and property transfer services) of mobile homes to this site. There is a mix of new and existing plots that will be made available, an estimated total of 14-20 plots over the lifetime of the contract. 
      
      Nuneaton and Bedworth Borough Council are now seeking a partnering supplier to lead and assist in the advertisement, sales, legalities, construction and siting of mobile homes to the site. This will be based on a concession fee to be calculated as a percentage share of the gross sale proceeds of a mobile home being payable by the supplier to Nuneaton and Bedworth Borough Council. 
      
      The Contract period is for an initial 2 years with an optional extension period for a further 12 months  solely at the Council's discretion, and will be dependent on the successful bidder's performance and the demand of sales.
Additional Text:
Please register via the Council`s e-procurement system - CSW-JETS   http://www.csw-jets.co.uk/

CSW-JETS is a sub-regional e-tendering portal run by In-tend. Since February 2010, Coventry; Solihull; Warwickshire; Nuneaton and Bedworth; Rugby alongside other local district Councils have been working together as a shared procurement service. In conjunction with Solihull Community Housing, we have joined together to bring you a collaborative E-Tendering portal. 

CSW-JETS enables us to advertise our opportunities across all authorities through the same system. This means that there is a single point of contact for procurement in the sub-region so you only have to register once to receive notifications for all authorities. Registering on the portal will make it easier for local suppliers to find, respond to and be alerted to tender opportunities. 

Registration is free, and takes just a few minutes. When complete, you will be able to express interest in any of the Councils'/Authorities' opportunities when they are made available including this tender. In addition, we will be able to access your details whenever we have a requirement, and you may then be invited to tender or quote for work.

Once you are registered and log in to the system you will be able to locate the tender opportunity, express interest and access the documentation.

Title: Estate Transformation Works at Camborne Campus - Refurbishment  Cornwall College
Description:
Cornwall College have been awarded a funding grant of c Â£11m to undertake an estate 
      improvement and rationalisation project at their Camborne Campus, Cornwall. The grant 
      follows an extensive and rigorous application process that the College have been through with 
      the Department for Education (DfE) over the past 12-18 months. 
      Cornwall College's Camborne Campus is a large site with many buildings and facilities, and the 
      existing estate ranges in both age and condition. The intent of the funding grant from the DfE 
      is to make improvements to the College's facilities to ensure they can continue to offer first 
      class Further Education teaching to the local community. 
      The project involves three key works packages - demolition, refurbishment of existing 
      buildings and site infrastructure. These packages will be let as separate contracts. 
      This tender opportunity is for the refurbishment of existing buildings element of the project 
      only, and will consist of an open two stage tender process with a contractor selected at the 
      first stage to enter into a pre construction services agreement (PCSA) with the College to agree 
      contract sums and programme for the three main contracts to be let under this tender. 
      The DfE funding grant agreement in place with Cornwall College is explicit that all works (and 
      therefore funding expenditure) must be completed by August 2024. This is a hard stop date. 
      Cornwall College have appointed a team of professional consultants to deliver the project. 
      Further details on the team are included in this ITT.
Additional Text:
For the tender document pack please contact: 
Ralph Gifford, Principal Project Manager - RalphGifford@wwa.uk.com 
or
Nick Hannett, Project Manager - nickhannett@wwa.uk.com

Title: NEW RECREATIONAL PLAY AREA & SKATE PARK - HOBBY CLOSE, WATERLOOVILLE
Description:
Portsmouth City Council, 'the Authority', is inviting Expressions of Interest from qualified ground works contractors to deliver a new recreational play area and skate park at Hobby Close Field in Wecock Farm, Waterlooville.
      
      The Council is running the procurement process in line with the 'Restricted Procedure' as set out within the 'Public Contracts Regulations (2015)' whereby a shortlist of 3-6 contractors devised via assessment of applications in response to this advert will be invited to submit tenders. 
      
      The existing play area and skate park are dated and offer little value to the community due to poor access and safety concerns from overgrown vegetation, inadequate fencing and insufficient levels of lighting.
      
      This project will address these issues with the installation of new play equipment, skate park, paths and lighting in order to attract the local residents and encourage additional use and enjoyment of the area, which will promote the Councils aspirations of improving community's health and levels of social activity.
      
      The installation of the new park will be complemented by land raising and drainage improvement works being undertaken on the adjacent football field on behalf of the Wecock Farm community by Havant Borough Council, with approval from the Authority as landowner. 
      
      The Authority will manage the tender and delivery stages of the new recreational play area & skate park only.
      
      The cost of the concept design has been estimated and the project has a budget set at ?500,000. The form of contract used is envisaged to be JCT Intermediate Building Contract with Contractor's Design 2016 (ICD).
      
      Set out below is the proposed procurement timetable. 
      
      o Re-issue  of SSQ - Friday 22nd May 2020
      o SSQ Clarification deadline - Friday 29th May 2020 at 23:59
      o SSQ submission deadline - Friday 5th June 2020 at 14:00
      o Invitation to tender issued - Friday 26th June 2020
      o Tenderers Briefing and Site Visit - TBC
      o Deadline for requests for clarification - Friday 24th July 2020
      o Tender return deadline - Friday 31st July 2020
      o Interviews (if required) - TBC
      o Standstill period - Friday 14th August 2020 to Thursday 20th August 2020
      o Contract award - Friday 21st August 2020
      o Contract Commencement on site - Monday 7th September 2020
Additional Text:
Portsmouth City Council is currently in the process of seeking expressions of interest for the following project - NEW RECREATIONAL PLAY AREA & SKATE PARK - HOBBY CLOSE, WATERLOOVILLE

The full details and ability to express an interest will be via our e-sourcing system Intend.  This filepath will take you to the relevant area of Intend, 

https://in-tendhost.co.uk/portsmouthcc/aspx/Tenders/Current

Once on the page you can either scroll down or use the search function to find the relevant project.

Should you have any problems with the above link, please contact us on 023 9268 8235 or email: procurement@portsmouthcc.gov.uk

Title: Soft market test and expressions of Interest (EOI) for the re-procurement of a Drug and Alcohol Case Management System
Description:
In 2018 Northamptonshire County Council procured and implemented a case management System to meet the requirements of the National Drugs Treatment Management System, which is a mandatory standard for Drug and Alcohol Services. The current contract has an annual value of Â£93,312 and expires on 31/03/2024.  The replacement contract will be for a period of 2 years (with no options to extend) to align with the recommissioning of all drug and alcohol services in 2026. Any re-procurement undertaken would be led by West Northants Council on behalf of North Northants and West Northants Councils.

The purpose of this exercise is to understand the level of interest in tendering for this Drug and Alcohol Case Management System for a 2 year contract, from suppliers who have the experience and capabilities to meet our requirements.
Attachments: Soft Market Test - Drug and Alcohol Case Management.docx D&A Case Management - SMT Clarifications.pdf

Title: Student e-portfolio
Description:
ITS073 STUDENT E-PORTFOLIO

THE UNIVERSITY SEEKS EXPRESSIONS OF INTEREST TO PARTICIPATE IN A PRELIMINARY MARKET CONSULTATION (PMC).

High Level Requirements

â€¢	An engaging, easy to navigate ePortfolio platform for our students to use.
â€¢	Enables students to upload evidence of their academic and professional development.
â€¢	Allows a range of media to be uploaded, including both written documents and audio/video recordings.
â€¢	Able to embed an established workbook template which students update to record reflections e.g., MYEPAD template for Nursing Programmes.
â€¢	Enables students to share their workbook with internal and external assessors in line with programme requirements.
â€¢	Enables those assessors to read, edit and share the updated workbook with students.
â€¢	Enables graduates to share ePortfolio content with prospective employers via an open accessible link or URL, e.g., placing a link within a LinkedIn profile.
â€¢	Ability to continue to use the platform beyond graduation for CPD activities.
â€¢	Potential to utilise for recording and tracking Personal Tutoring activities.
â€¢	Ability to extract data and insights for reporting purposes.
â€¢	Ability to integrate with institutional VLE (Moodle).
â€¢	Ensures that all users including administrators access the systems through Single Sign On (SSO) or Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).

High Level Plan 
â€¢	End Sept 2022 - PMC responses consolidated
â€¢	Mid Oct 2022 - conclusion of any meetings/ dialogue under PMC
â€¢	Mid Oct 2022 - business case submission and approval
â€¢	End Oct 2022 - Publish procurement documents
â€¢	Early Dec 2022 - Intention to award published
â€¢	Early Jan 2023 - Contract Award
â€¢	Feb-Sept 2023 - Implementation and testing
â€¢	September 2023 - System Live

In respect of the above Leeds Trinity University seeks advice from independent experts/authorities/market participants with a view to developing the scope and specifications needed to plan and conduct its procurement procedures.  

For the avoidance of doubt, no call for competition has been made, and no contract award opportunity identified.  All relevant information exchanged or resulting from this PMC will be documented and where not considered commercially confidential, may be communicated to other candidates and tenderers participating in any resultant procurement procedure.  

Please advise you interest by e-mail to Mark Hayter, Head of Procurement at m.hayter@leedstrinity.ac.uk no later than 30th September 2022

Title: Office Alterations and Refurbishment Works at West Oxfordshire District Council
Description: West Oxfordshire  District Council has adopted a policy of hybrid working, resulting in more home working for staff. The Council has decided to reduce the office space it occupies and to rent out the vacated space to new tenants. The works set out in this ITT will enable the Woodgreen offices to accommodate more staff, provide enhanced room provision for Councillors and redirect customers to a new reception point  ; comprising refurbishment and alteration works. The works are anticipated to commence in June 2023 and will entail the temporary relocation within the building, of an existing tenant.

Title: P0936 - Community Research Hub
Description:
The Council wishes to establish a contract for the provision of community research hub.
      
      There is a requirement to increase community research in Birmingham by:
      
      o bringing together expert advisors who are community researchers, academics and leaders in the community and voluntary sector to design and advise on the development and delivery of the hub 
      o providing a hub 'space' where diverse community researchers representative of Birmingham City's population can be recruited, trained, coordinated and supported.  
      o delivering 4 community research projects for the Public Health Division annually 
      
      The Contract will be for a period of 3 years (unless terminated under the terms and conditions of contract).
      
      The contract will be awarded to one supplier. 
       
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant Invitation to Tender (ITT) documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk 
      
      Your completed tender submission should be returned by noon on 7th July 2023 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Title: Princecroft Primary School (Main Works)
Description: This ITT relates to the main contract works at Princecroft Primary School, Warminster which involves the construction of a new school hall as well as a small extension to the rear of the school and the conversion of the existing hall into classroom accommodation as well as internal remodelling works to address a number of functionality issues with the existing layout and design of the school: To improve the reception facilities for parents and visitors to the school through the introduction of a protected lobby. To improve the open plan class room layout through the introduction of some partition walls to create small work/group rooms. To improve the circulation around the school avoiding the need for having to walk through classrooms to get to other parts of the school. To improve the facilities for the staff (the current staff room is too small).

Organisation Name: Devon and Somerset Fire and Rescue Authority
Title: Energy Efficiency and Decarbonisation Feasibility Study Consultancy
Description:
*This Contract has now been awarded*
We recognise that in order to achieve energy efficiency and in-use carbon reductions at our premises we will need support from industry experts to consider appropriate solutions and technologies. With each of our 80+ sites being relatively unique we have selected ten (10) locations that represent a broad cross section of our use and activities. We are looking to work with a partner to deliver site specific feasibility reports focussing on energy efficiency and decarbonisation solutions for these sites initially, with the potential for further sites during the life of the Contract (two years + option to extend up to two years).

The scope of the Contract shall include but not be limited to, data analysis, identifying energy reduction opportunities, proposing potential decarbonisation solutions through cost/benefit analysis. The contract does not include delivery or management of any proposed solutions. 

Please access the tender via our e-tendering portal, download and complete the documents and upload your response to the tendering portal by the closing date and time.
Contact Address 1: Service Headquarters, The Knowle, Clyst St George

Title: International Bilateral Fund
Description:
The UK Space Agency (UKSA) is an executive agency of the Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy (BEIS) and provides technical advice on theâ€¯government's space strategy, supporting the UK space sector to deliver the government's vision.  
The Integrated Review and Pillar 2 of the National Space Strategy (NSS) highlight the UK's ambition to " increase our bilateral and multilateral partnerships with other spacefaring nations, forging the best relationships to achieve our goals in space.". To support our international ambitions, there are a range of funding opportunities, including the International Bilateral Fund (IBF), which will (subject to business case approvals) open in April 2023 and carry across until March 2025.The IBF is designed to fund UK space projects which focus on both the UK's strategic priority countries, as referenced in the National Space Strategy, and emerging space nations. 
The objectives of the IBF are to:
â€¢	Build stronger relationships with international partners and become a trusted partner of choice
â€¢	Increase UK space sector inward investment and exports
â€¢	Develop UK capabilities in collaboration with our international partners. 

The fund will leverage Â£20m worth of investment across UKSA's eight priority areas to deliver on our value proposition to catalyse investment, build and develop UK missions and capabilities, and to champion space on the international stage.   
The IBF could include projects which, for example, tackle global challenges like climate change or support projects which focus on sustainability or low-earth orbit capabilities.
This IBF-RFI will help guide UKSA's next steps and aid our understanding of potential projects that the sector is currently exploring or would like to explore, with international partners.  We are seeking responses from organisations willing to conduct the work in the UK to meet the objectives of the National Space Strategy.

How to apply
If you believe this opportunity will be of interest to you or your organisation, please complete the questionnaire in the attachment.
Attachments: UKSA International Bilateral Fund RFI V0.pdf International Bilat Fund RFI - External Slides.pptx

Title: Spectral Reflectometer - AWARD
Description:
The University of Warwick has a requirement to purchase a spectral reflectometer consisting of a microscope with Deuterium and Tungsten-Halogen light sources, Si array detection spectrometer, CCD sample imaging system, fibre optic cables, plus software for the measurement of thickness, optical constants (such as refractive index) of transparent thin films. The reflectometer will reside in the Science City Cleanroom facility in the School of Engineering (the cleanroom staff will provide routine imaging and be used to train a wide range of users across Warwick University.
      
      In order to express interest in this opportunity please go to the University of Warwick In-Tend supplier portal (https://in-tendhost.co.uk/universityofwarwick).
      
      The University of Warwick is not a contracting authority for the purposes of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 (as amended) and its procurement activities are not subject to the Public Contracts Regulations 2015 or the obligations under the European Public Procurement Directives, including the European Remedies Directive. Advertisement of any contract in the Official Journal of the European Union or Contracts Finder is at the sole discretion of the University and is undertaken on a voluntary basis with no implied obligation to comply with the procurement legislation.
      
      Please note the tender submission deadline is 12 Midday on Thursday 16th November 2017.

Title: Long Term Monitoring Network - vegetation survey - Chippenham Fen NNR - 2023
Description: For Natural England's Long Term Monitoring Network project, at Chippenham Fen National Nature Reserve, 2023. A vegetation survey comprising recording of plant species presence and cover, and other attributes, in 50 no. 2m2 permanent monitoring plots across the site. Preparation work includes relocating the permanent plot markers - feno markers - and re-recording the exact location using high-accuracy gps. The collected data is provided on an Excel template and quality assured, with a short summary report.

Notice Identifier: London Borough of Lambeth Planning & Sustainability145
Title: Energy and Sustainability Support for Planning Development
Description:
The London Borough of Lambeth are seeking to appoint a consultancy to provide support to its Development Management team.

This support will comprise of assessment of energy and sustainability submissions that accompany relevant planning applications (excluding applications which are subject to Planning Performance Agreements) and condition/s106 discharge applications. 

Following assessment, the Council will require you to advise on the degree of compliance with current planning policy requirements, on potential amendments that would further improve the performance of the developments and on suggested conditions and planning obligations that would ensure the delivery of the highest standards of sustainable design and construction and subsequent operation.  Timing of responses to all consultations are expected to be as swift as possible, to enable the council to deliver against its statutory planning application performance targets - 8 weeks for minor and other applications and 13 weeks for major applications and should form part of your proposal.

The selected contractor delivering the service will be required to collaborate remotely with officers within the Development Management service.  The provision will be for an off-site, electronic service.  Meetings and site visits for more complex sites may also be required from time to time along with occasional attendance at the council's Planning Applications Committee.
Attachments: Energy and Sustainability Consultancy Contract - 2023-2025.doc RFQ Draft - Energy and Sustainability support 260423 Procurement Review FINAL -FY 23-24 MDV (002).docx

Energy and Sustainability Support for Planning Development The London Borough of Lambeth are seeking to appoint a consultancy to provide support to its Development Management team.

This support will comprise of assessment of energy and sustainability submissions that accompany relevant planning applications (excluding applications which are subject to Planning Performance Agreements) and condition/s106 discharge applications. 

Following assessment, the Council will require you to advise on the degree of compliance with current planning policy requirements, on potential amendments that would further improve the performance of the developments and on suggested conditions and planning obligations that would ensure the delivery of the highest standards of sustainable design and construction and subsequent operation. Title: School Flu Vaccination Programme - Insight & Recommendations
Description:
Sandwell Public Health are looking to commission a piece of insight work into understanding the barriers and challenges to achieving high uptake of the flu vaccine in specific schools in Sandwell.  The successful bidder will be expected to:
      - Gain insight with the following groups using qualitative research methods:
         - Group 1: Three Sandwell schools which have low return of consent forms 
         -Group 2: Three Sandwell school which have high rate of refusals for flu vaccine 
         - Group 3: Three Sandwell schools which have high uptake of flu vaccine programme 
      - Report on research findings including recommendations for tools to increase uptake with each group.  
      - Market testing of tools with each group
      - Report on findings from market testing.   
      
      The Quotation Document(s) will be made available to suppliers who Express Interest on the Sandwell Metropolitan Borough Council Tendering Portal. To access the portal please click the following link https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sandwellmbc
      
      You will be required to log into an existing account or register a new one. Once logged in, from the top menu bar click on 'Tenders' to list all the current opportunities. Once you have found the relevant opportunity you should click on 'View Details' in order to Express Interest.
      
      Closing date for submission of quotations is 28 November 2017 Report on findings from market testing.

Title: Request for Bids for the Supply & Installation and Repairs & Maintenance of White Goods and Electrical Appliances
Description:
Newlon Housing Trust (NHT) is a highly successful charitable housing association based in North and East London. We work to provide people in housing need with decent and affordable homes and with our Group member Outward to help individuals and communities reach their full potential.

We currently have approximately 1,200 intermediate rent properties in the North and East London areas where white goods are supplied and maintained. There is some variation in that some properties have fewer appliances provided than others (for example, not all properties have washing machines, some have separate ovens and hobs etc.). However, it is estimated that we provide approximately 6,000 items in total where we repair or replace in the event of a breakdown. The majority of items are of a standard specification but there are some exceptions, e.g. built-in appliances, so we would be looking for a supplier who is set up to deal with such variation.

Newlon Housing Trust is seeking a supplier(s) for the following lots:

- Lot 1 provide supply and installation of white goods and electrical appliances

- Lot 2 provide repairs and maintenance service for white goods and electrical appliances.

Interested suppliers who are able to deliver Value for Money in terms of cost and quality across a range of items for Newlon Housing Trust are invited respond to this Request for Bids (RFB).

The contract value published in this notice is an estimate only and it is for bidders to review all of the tender documents and inform themselves fully of all conditions. NHT reserves the right not to award a contract for either Lot.

[The Appliance Warehouse Limited|9 Decimus Park
Kingstanding Way
Tunbridge Wells
Kent

Description:
Scarborough Borough Council is looking for individuals or an organisation who can manage this overall project from the point where funding is available.
The project calls for a Project Manager who will oversee the project and ensure that all requirements for monitoring and reporting, timescales, agreements, procurements and co-development of the evaluation process is completed. The project manage will report to and work with the Project Steering Group to drive the project forward.
The project further calls for a Business Liaison Manager who will work with local tourism businesses to promote the Virtual Academy and nurture new tourism-based experiences.

Title: UKSPF Business Advisory Services Tender
Description:
Basildon Borough Council (BBC) are looking to procure a business support provider to deliver additional business support advisory services across two years - 2023/24 & 2024/25 for businesses and residents based within the Borough. 

This is a one-off project estimated to last two years (subject to the Council's sole option to terminate in whole or part at the end of Year 1 on at least one months' notice if the Council is not in receipt of or only partially receive the final year of UKSPF where there is a failure to meet outcomes and targets and no realistic plan to address underperformance).

The allocated revenue funding is intended to cover the costs of additional Business Advisory Support Capacity, any lead generation activities and travel expenses over the lifetime of the project and the capital funding is intended to support the cost of any equipment needed, together with a number of capital grants to businesses etc.  Basildon Council would envisage working with the nominated supplier to agree the precise nature and structure of the grant award programme once supplier is appointed. 

The provider will be expected to generate sufficient leads to achieve the contractual targets set out within the service specification, although the Council may also be able to support with some marketing and promotion.  

For example, in response to the situation described above, Basildon  Council has been undertaking a pilot project to explore whether we could offer additional support to companies that we have identified as being 'In Distress' and those with 'Scaleup Potential', and we would envisage these companies being particularly good beneficiaries to target with the additional business advisory support capacity we put in place through this contract. 

This project is funded by the UK Shared Prosperity Fund. The contractor will need to have regard to the UKSPF Prospectus and Additional Guidance https://www.gov.uk/government/collections/uk-shared-prosperity-fund-additional-information  when delivering this project to ensure that Basildon Borough Council can comply with the reporting and performance management, monitoring and evaluation, assurance and risk and branding and publicity guidelines. Basildon Borough's UKSPF Investment Plans can be found at https://basildon.gov.uk/article/9154/Basildon-for-Business-The-UK-Shared-Prosperity-Fund-UKSPF.

Basildon Council requires a specialist organisation to deliver free business support across Basildon Borough for a period of up to two years for the purpose of increasing the number of businesses accessing support services from within the Borough. This will include a series of targeted interventions to raise the profile of the available support, such as (as a minimum) workshops, webinars, targeted marketing campaigns and drop-in sessions.

Interested bidders please read the ITT attached to this notice. Suppliers must submit their bids on: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/delta and use the Access Code: RM6SJ99M29
Attachments: Service Specification UKSPF General Business Support (E23) v002.docx 2. Draft ITT. General Business Support.docx

Title: TENDER FOR THE SUPPLY OF PLAY AREA EQUIPMENT REPAIRS AND PLAY AREA AND BALL COURT SURFACE REPAIRS.
Description:
Basingstoke and Deane Borough Council (the council) currently has over 140 play areas and 14 ball courts throughout the borough. The Council is seeking to appoint a contractor to supply both a planned and reactive repair service encompassing all of the play areas and ball courts within the borough. The successful contractor will be capable of repairing all makes and types of play equipment together with surface repairs. A full inventory of equipment and locations will be supplied within the tender documentation.  

This contract will be for three years with an option for a further 1 year extension and is expected to commence on 1st November 2017.

Title: Specialist Engineering Consultant
Description:
This proposal is a request for the resource of a Specialist engineering conultant to work with the MCA in responding to Emission Reduction projects. This support is specifically sought to respond to the projects withn the Emission Reduction function and lead the team in this area. The initial timeline for this resource is 5 days, per week commencing 02.11.20 to end on 31.03.20. The Specialist engineering consultant assist MCA to pick up on current project work, and all future work packages that are currently stagnate in the department. This kind of skill set cannot be transferred. It takes years of working in a specialist hands on role to achieve these kinds of skill and knowledge and adjacent markets are ahead of the Maritime Emission Reduction Industry on this. All projects that have yet to start / complete, will not be able to complete without the specialist support role in situe.By having the consultant, it enables MCA to:- Provide expert engineering input to support the development, maintenance and delivery of the Maritime Future Technologies programme/work plan and to enable delivery against the plan. This will include advising on prioritisation of where we should focus our efforts/engagement. 
-Build expertise in implementation of new fuels from a regulatory perspective so that technical advice can be given to operators to design and build ships with new propulsion technologies and energy saving measures.-Supporting the development of maritime regulation (within MCA remit) and engagement with other regulators that have an interest to strategically enable the scale uptake of zero emission technologies to support the Government's ambitions set out in the Clean Maritime Plan.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Interim Partners Ltd|The Exchange, Station Parade Harrogate HG1 1TS England|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Decking Timber Supply (Purchase, Vesting, Storage and Delivery) for Southend on Sea Pier
Description:
Southend Borough Council is carrying out this procurement exercise in the form of an Open Tender to purchase a Â£150,000 lot of 200mm x 50mm prepared (planed and machined) Keruing certified hardwood to be delivered in lengths of 5.20 metres of Grade Selects and Better.
The materials are to be stored in a secure warehouse provided by the timber supplier, clearly vested (allowing inspection by the Council) to indicate ownership by SBC. The provision of transport and the means to off load and load onto transport to be provided by the timber supplier and to be taken into account when calculating the amount of timber to be supplied. The maximum number of deliveries over the 12 months will be 8 (approx. every 6 weeks) from start of contract. The price must include the purchase, vesting, storage, loading and carriage, delivery and off-loading and placing by hand into the container according to industry packing standards. The procurement process will be conducted electronically via the Council's e-tender facility Procontract:
https://procurement.southend.gov.uk/southend/portal.nsf/index.htm You need to Express an Interest in this opportunity, then look at 'My Opportunities' where you will be able to find and view all the tender documents.

Title: GB-London: Research into recent dynamics of the press sector in the UK and globally
Description:
The Department for Digital, Culture, Media and Sport (DCMS) is seeking to appoint a Supplier to undertake research into the press market, both in the UK and globally. In particular we would like to understand:
      
      1) The relationship between local news consumption and democratic engagement. 
      
      2) The different forms of government support, including subsidies, that the press industry receives in other jurisdictions.
      
      Refer to the ITT for additional information.

Title: CPQ1503-17 Safeguarding Adults Training - Leading Safeguarding Enquiries
Description:
Devon Safeguarding Adult Board (DSAB) is looking for a sole Supplier who in accordance within the stated course aims and objectives can provide both of the following courses to help train the County Council and Statutory Partners professionals to be competent to lead individual and whole service S42 Enquiries:

a)	A one day 'Leading Enquiries' course delivered to a maximum of 24 people. This course will support delegates in developing the requisite knowledge and skills to enable them to become competent and understand their responsibilities in leading S42 enquiries regarding individual adults at risk.

b)	A one day 'Whole Service Enquiry' course delivered to a maximum of 24 people. This course will support delegates for whom leading Whole Service Enquires or elements thereof will be a requirement of their role and who have the necessary experience. The course will support them in developing the requisite knowledge and skills to enable them to become competent and understand their accountabilities in leading whole service S42 enquiries.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Able Training and Consultancy|51 Scotton Street, Wye, Ashford, Kent, TN25 5BU|NONE||Yes|No]

Title: Red Ensign Group - Marine Surveyor Training Videos
Description:
This requirement will enable the production of a series of short files for the training of marine surveyors in Red Ensign Group. This will include the travel, filming, editing, rendering and close-captioning of the footage to be provided in a Vimeo and You-tube ready format. 

Videos to be completed consist of:

Steel Vessels
Wooden Vessels
Machinery Inspections
Electrical Inspections
Steering Gear
Vessel Systems
Service Inspections 
Specialist areas further to the above as identified

The UK Government, through the Conflict, Stability and Security Fund (CSSF) is delivering a number of activities to uplift capacity and capability within the Overseas Territories to raise the level of compliance across flag, port and coastal state requirements. 

The conduct of marine surveyor training, in particular within the smaller Category 2 registers, develops critical Port State Controls and continues ongoing work within the programme in upskilling Overseas Territory personnel. 

Videographic content produced provides a valuable learning opportunity and platform on island training is not practical nor cost efficient. A permeant online resource that can be accessed remotely as often and whenever is required does provide value for money. It also presents an opportunity to provide a possible revenue stream if utilised by other developing States outside of the Red Ensign Group.   

Amendment to notice reflects the extension to the contract up to 31st of March 2024.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [James Harrison Productions|Lansdowne House, Long Street, Devizes, SN10 1NJ|NONE_OTHER||Yes|Yes]

Organisation Name: Breckland District Council and South Holland District Council
Title: 051-BK-23 Integrated Assessment of the Breckland Local Plan Review
Description: Summary of Requirement: Breckland Council requires an Integrated Assessment (IA) for the Full Update of the Local Plan.  To be effective, an IA must be an integral part of plan preparation.  It comprises a Sustainability Appraisal (including the requirements of Strategic Environmental Assessment), a Health Impact Assessment (HIA) and an Equalities Impact Assessment (EqIA) of the plan.  An IA should also be an iterative process by which elements of the plan, including policies and site allocations, are assessed against agreed IA objectives, relevant alternative options considered, and necessary revisions made.
Additional Text: Is a Recurrent Procurement Type? : No

Description:
Provision of the Business Skills Module of The Strategic Command Course (SCC) and a Programme of Chief Officer Leadership Development for the College of Policing.

How to apply Instructions to Potential Providers: 

Potential Providers must first be registered on the Crown Commercial Service e-Sourcing Suite in order to respond to the Procurement. If you have not yet registered on the e-Sourcing Suite, this can be done online at https://gpsesourcing.cabinetoffice.gov.uk by following the link 'Register for CCS e-Sourcing'. 

Please note that, to register, you must have a valid DUNS number (as provided by Dun and Bradstreet) for the organisation which you are registering, who will be entering into a contract if invited to do so at the Invitation to Tender stage. Potential Providers should note that it could take up to 10 working days to obtain a DUNS number.

- name/reference of this procurement

Title: Sandy Cadet Centre Refurbishment
Description:
East Anglia Reserve Forces and Cadets Association are planning to carry out refurbishment works to the Cadet Centre in Sandy, Bedfordshire. Works to include: internal and external decoration, installing new kitchen and sanitary ware, installing new lighting and other electrical fittings.
All contract staff will need to be approved to Basic Personnel Security Standard level in accordance with MoD Requirements under JSP440.
Qualification process for the RFCAs is managed on their behalf by Constructionline, using PAS91 and SSIP and membership of Constructionline to silver level is a pre-requisite of any contract award.
The form of contract will be JCT Minor Works Building Contract 2016.

Title: Leisure Management System Software (LMSS)
Description:
NTU wish to undertake a pre-procurement market engagement exercise before any possible procurement is started, to determine suitable Leisure Management systems, capabilities, and services.

NTU Sport's current Leisure Management System Software is used to manage NTU Sport's facilities and operations; this includes data reporting, access control, point of sale, online payments (membership etc.) and customer relationship management. The current platform is hosted on an NTU shared server, however there is the option to be hosted by the supplier.

The system enables us to engage with and track over 10,000 students / staff, and the local community that participate in our programmes. We analyse a significant amount data from the Leisure Management System that provides insight to support our decision making. 

We are conducting this exercise to allow us to better understand our options for the procurement and implementation of suitable software that will meet ours and our customers needs, and are in line with the university foundations to be innovative and digitally sophisticated.

At this stage we will not be formally assessing proposals, so nothing provided at this stage will be evaluated as part of any future procurement process. We welcome responses from organisations who feel that they have ideas on how our vision can be delivered, and comment on the extent to which our requirements are reasonable, realistic, and properly specified. If you feel your organisation can contribute to this exercise, please email Lewis Simpson to request a document containing further details. Please provide responses to the questions in the document and return it via email to lewis.simpson@ntu.ac.uk no later than 12:00 on Thursday 30th September 2021.

Following receipt of the responses, and depending on the information we obtain from this exercise, we may invite a selection of respondents to attend separate workshop sessions to present and discuss their responses between Monday 18th October and Friday 22nd October 2021. 

Organisations not attending a session will not be disadvantaged in any future procurement, as this pre-procurement market engagement is only an exploratory fact-finding exercise: it is not an invitation to tender or a request for formal expressions of interest. Any supplier invited to present or provide information to NTU is doing so to support pre-procurement market research only, to help make any future procurement more focused and efficient, and to clarify NTU's requirements. The expected formal procurement process will start only after completion of this pre-procurement market engagement or soft market testing exercise.

Please apply to the buyer using the contact details in this notice.

Title: E-Scooter Service Concessions Contract within the West Midlands
Description:
This ITT is a concession arrangement to operate an e-scooter scheme in the West Midlands Combined Authority area. The scheme would comprise a fleet of e-scooters, together with docking and geo-fencing or station facilities, and supporting infrastructure, business processes and services. The scheme would operate in the West Midlands Combined Authority area. The contract proposed is an income contract to the WMCA; it is not a spending contract. There will be no cost to the WMCA. On the contrary, it should secure annual income to WMCA, as a percentage share of the service revenue.

WMCA intends to select a supplier in line with this process to design, build, test, operate and maintain a system and supporting business processes for the provision of services in relation to the West Midlands e-scooter Hire Services. We seek these outcomes from the tendering process:

- A new services concession agreement with an e-scooter service provider, who will take full responsibility for implementation and operation up to 31st October 2025; and

- Deployment of up to 7,500 fully managed e-scooters, generating a net income for the region.

This will require the close collaboration with LA and TfWM colleagues to ensure the scheme is run in accordance with local infrastructure, adjacent schemes and local needs.
Additional Text: Process is being conducted through Bravo
Additional Details: Process is being conducted through Bravo

Title: Communities in the South Downs: Evaluation of Pilot Interventions
Description:
SDNPA is seeking to appoint a consultant to evaluate the pilot interventions from the Communities in the South Downs project, set up to establish highway enhancement schemes in order to address local issues whilst conserving and enhancing the special qualities of the communities involved. 
      The successful bidder will be required to carry out surveys and gather data to produce: 
      
      a baseline report to show the traffic speeds/flows/composition at pilot scheme locations, 
      a final report to compare and contrast the data from follow up surveys at each of three pilot locations, evaluating the effectiveness of the pilot interventions in combatting specific issues.
Additional Text:
SDNPA use an electronic sourcing portal to manage all tendering and quotation exercises and current and future contract opportunities can be viewed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/southdowns.

In order to view the full documents available it is necessary to register with the portal.

Registration is free and only has to be done once.
