Title: MT060 - Provision of Building Maintenance Services
Description: This tender process is for the provision of Building Maintenance services at Moat's head office, Mariner House in Dartford. This office is a daily base for approximately 270 staff who predominantly carry out administration duties.Mariner House is a 3 storey, steel framed purpose built office block constructed in 2005. The building consists of external glazed walls, solid floors and a single internal staircase. Throughout there are open plan offices with a combination of glazed and plasterboard partitions to enclosed offices and meeting rooms. Externally a metal staircase acts as a fire escape with roof top plant room and open plant area.Having previously managed all of the associated maintenance through a number of contractors, we are now looking to combine all of the elements of maintenance for Mariner House under one contractor, encompassing the following:- Mechanical, Electrical & Public Health maintenance- Fabric maintenance- Handyman services

Title: Development of a Preceptorship for Physician Associates in Hospital Eye Health
Description:
Hospital Eye Services (HES) require a significant expansion in an 'allied' workforce to meet the requirements of the increasing demand to Ophthalmology services across the country. 

PAs are currently working across 46 specialties both in the hospital and in primary and community care, but none are known to work within an Ophthalmology setting. The initial training and core capabilities framework for Physician Associates (PAs) position them as valuable members of a multidisciplinary team in the HES.

The objective of this project is the development of a 'preceptorship' training programme for PAs in eye health incorporating the Ophthalmic Practitioner Training (OPT) Programme and piloting this across at least two HES sites.
Attachments: REDACTED NHS TERMS AND CONDITIONS FOR THE PROVISION OF SERVICES FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A PRECEPTORSHIP FOR PHYSICIAN ASSOCIATES IN HOSPITAL EYE HEALTH_ (002).pdf

Title: 21124 Cambridgeshire County Council (CCC) and Peterborough City Council (PCC) Multi-Disciplinary Floating Support
Description:
The service will deliver short term tenancy support to working age adults in their own homes across the geographical areas of Cambridgeshire and Peterborough.

The Cambridgeshire service will also include a Mental Health component aimed at providing a slightly more intensive level of tenancy support for people who have mental health issues, but who would not generally be assessed as eligible for a service from the statutory mental health services.

The contract is for an initial 36 months with the option to extend by  x2 12 month extensions. The total contract duration is therefore potentially up to 60 months.

This tender is linked to the previous contract finder notice for early engagement: CCC001-DN602448-94488497

Organisation Name: THE HORNIMAN PUBLIC MUSEUM AND PUBLIC PARK TRUST
Title: Fire Stopping Works - Measured Term Contract
Description:
The principal objective of the work is to improve passive fire protection in the SCC building, which is a Victorian school building used for storage of historical artefacts, and the main Museum, which is Grade II* Listed and is a major public attraction.
The works required can be summarized within four distinct work streams: fire doors, fire stopping, fire-resisting glazing and loft sub-division. The Horniman wishes to appoint a suitably qualified contractor who can demonstrate competence by virtue of third-party certification against a recognized competency scheme for passive fire protection. These may include the following schemes:
ï‚· LPS 1531.
ï‚· Q-Mark by BM Trada.
ï‚· FIRAS Certification.
ï‚· IFC Certification.
The contractor must be able to demonstrate certification by a recognized scheme and must commit to deliver the works in accordance with the Scheme requirements. The contractor will design and deliver all works in accordance with their relevant Scheme accreditation. The sites are fully operational, occupied and staffed storage facility that houses the majority of the museum's collection and a museum open to the public. As such, extreme care is required when working within the building and around the stored collection. Paying particular attention to mitigating the impact of dust, debris, water, accidental damage and safe systems of work especially around the moving and use of ladders and access equipment.
The effective management of health and safety risks and programme is considered key for the successful delivery of these works with all work to be completed before the 31st March 2023. The fixed term element of the contract is to allow for further remedial works in the following year.
A compliant tender requires tender submission all of the required information to be submitted in digital format to be received by the Horniman Museum by 12 noon Wednesday 15th February 2023.
We will not accept tender submissions from companies who have not undertaken a site visit.
Please contact Adele Harrington (Project Co-ordinator) on aharrington@horniman.ac.uk to book a site visit, which will be undertaken as group visits at the SCC.
Time slots available for the SCC site visit:
- Tuesday 7th February 10.30 am
- Monday 13th February 10.30 am
Site visits to The Horniman Museum can take place anytime during the museums opening times. The areas are open to the public and supervision is not required.
Please note, we are anticipating a number of responses to this tender opportunity. Therefore the adjudication panel will be undertaking a two stage scoring method. All compliant tenders will be initially assessed and scored according to their cost submissions (representing a maximum of 60% of the total score available). Once
these have been assessed we will then undertake the quality assessment and scoring for the four most economically competitive tenders only. The tender returns will be assessed on the following weighting:
60% Cost
40% Quality
Attachments: Invitation to Tender 2023-02-01.pdf Horniman Museum - Fire stopping works v1.1.pdf 01 - Tender documentation - February 2023.xlsx 02 - Tender documentation - Appendix A.pdf 03 - Tender documentation - Appendix B.pdf Museum Rules for Visiting Contractors 2021.pdf Quality Questions & Scoring Methodology.pdf Procurement - anti-fraud and bribery statements (002).docx Tender Clarifications 2023 - 02-14.pdf

Organisation Name: Mayors Office for Policing and Crime (MOPAC)
Title: GLA81404 For Embedded Youth Work Hospital Accident & Emergency (A&E) Service
Description:
MOPAC is commissioning a Hospital-based Embedded Youth Work Service at 5 London hospital A&E sites. This is a 2 year contract with the option to extend for 1 year. The Service is being procured as four Lots, aligned with the NHS Trust structures, in order to promote collaboration and partnership working between A&Es that fall under a single trust as set out below. Bidder can bid for one or more Lots :

Lot 1 - Croydon University Hospital A&E (Croydon Health Services NHS Trust)
Lot 2 - University Hospital Lewisham A&E and The Queen Elizabeth Hospital A&E (Lewisham and Greenwich NHS Trust)
Lot 3 - Newham University Hospital A&E (Barts Health Trust)
Lot 4 - The Whittington A&E (Whittington Health NHS Trust)

There is a brief description of each of the five A&E Departments within the specification. It is important to note that all the A&Es serve a population wider than the borough within which they are located. There is therefore an expectation that the Service supports young people attending the A&E regardless of where they live.

The Service is aimed at vulnerable 12 to 25 year-olds who attend the adult or paediatric A&E departments or Urgent Care Centres at the five hospitals listed above. The Service must work alongside the team in the A&E to proactively identify vulnerable young people and help them to access and engage the support they need to prevent any potential escalation of violence and reduce the risk of repeat victimisation or exploitation.

The Service will provide brief interventions - including safety-planning, practical and emotional support tailored to children and young people - following treatment at the A&E department.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Redthread Youth Ltd|158 Buckingham Palace Road, London SW1W 9TR|NONE||No|No][St Giles Trust|64 - 68 Camberwell Church Street, London, SE5 8JB|NONE||Yes|No]

Organisation Name: Department for Business, Energy & Industrial Strategy
Title: UKSA22_0018 - Disaster Charter Operational Support Contract
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Wednesday, 7th September 2022 at 17:00.

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

The UK Space Agency (UKSA) is an Executive Agency of the Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS). As part of its work to grow the space sector and promote the benefits of using space technology and services within the UK Government and around the globe, the UKSA is proud to be contribute to the International Charter: Space and Major Disasters, working alongside industry and international partners to assist those in need. 

The Charter aims to provide a unified system of space data acquisition and delivery to those affected by natural or man-made disasters. Further details on the Charter can be found at https://disasterscharter.org/.  
 
The UK has been a Charter member since 2005 and wishes to continue to play an active leadership role. UKSA has a requirement for specialist operational support to ensure the Charter is performing effectively, interfacing effectively with existing and any potential new data providers and users and ensuring there is optimal awareness and uptake of the Charter within the UK Government and with selected overseas partners.

Please ensure you review all attached information to ensure a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found with the Supplier Attachments tab within the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal. 

This contract will be awarded based on the evaluation criteria as set out in the RFP document. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Jaggaer eSourcing portal please use the link https://beisgroup.ukp.app.jaggaer.com/ and follow the instructions to register as a supplier.

If you are already registered on the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://beisgroup.ukp.app.jaggaer.com/.

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to locate the Procurement you wish to leave a bid on by clicking the ITTs Open to All Suppliers and searching for the reference number UKSA22_0018.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Jaggaer eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Jaggaer eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Jaggaer messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

Title: Servicing and maintenance of passenger lifts, platform lifts and stair lifts
Description:
Flagship Group would like to appoint a supplier or suppliers to deliver its entire Passenger Lift, Platform Lift and Stair Lift strategy for servicing and maintenance.  
      The current housing stock consists of almost 33,000 properties that are owned and managed by Flagship Group, this is split into a federated structure of three Housing Associations: Newtide Homes, Samphire Homes and Victory Homes, with the stock split evenly between them.  The Flagship Group retains the responsibility for servicing and maintenance of passenger lifts, platform lifts and stair lifts across all three Housing associations.  These are spread over a wide geographical area (see appendix D).
      The Group's portfolio consists of 55 communal Passenger Lifts, and 163 Stair or Platform Lifts, in both communal areas and domestic properties.
      
      The requirement is split into two lots - one for Passenger Lifts and another for Stair and Platform Lifts.

Title: SEM (Search Engine Marketing)
Description:
CITB are looking for a digital agency to provide SEM (Search Engine Marketing) and analytic support to our in-house website and marketing teams. With the aim of increasing visits and transactions on our sites.
      We have a different internal set up for each website, therefore support for CITB website will be focused on providing ad hoc specialist support to the team on a project-by-project basis. Whereas the Go Construct website has no internal website team and as such there is a greater requirement for agency support, covering both ongoing maintenance and site improvements as well as specific digital marketing campaigns. 
      We are looking for experts who will challenge our way of thinking and provide us with new approaches to this work, reviewing our briefs and providing us with recommendations. We need the agency to be proactive in their approach to working with us, spotting potential issues and providing solutions we may not have even considered.

SEM (Search Engine Marketing) CITB are looking for a digital agency to provide SEM (Search Engine Marketing) and analytic support to our in-house website and marketing teams. With the aim of increasing visits and transactions on our sites.

Whereas the Go Construct website has no internal website team and as such there is a greater requirement for agency support, covering both ongoing maintenance and site improvements as well as specific digital marketing campaigns. 
      We are looking for experts who will challenge our way of thinking and provide us with new approaches to this work, reviewing our briefs and providing us with recommendations. We need the agency to be proactive in their approach to working with us, spotting potential issues and providing solutions we may not have even considered.

Title: Tender for Visitor Profiling Service - AWARD
Description:
At National Museums Liverpool (NML) we have diverse audiences that attend our seven core venues, with over three million visitors a year. We are seeking an insights and analysis company that can deliver a customer profiling service to report on our audience demographics, measure our economic impact, rate our facilities and rate quality of visit.
      
      We want to deeply understand our visitors, therefore, it is imperative that the successful tenderer has a forward-looking approach to behavioural science in measuring the sentiment and psychology of our visitors' experience. They will be required to provide a functioning framework in which the overall enjoyment of a visit can be measured and then broken down into talking points for internal evaluation.
      
      We require least some of the data to be collected from in person interviews, however, this can be supported by online surveys, if needed.  Currently, as a minimum we require a survey round once each month at World Museum, Maritime Museum, International Slavery Museum, Museum of Liverpool, Walker Art Gallery, Sudley House and Lady Lever Art Gallery.
      
      The contract duration is for an initial period of 2 years with the option to extend for three 12 monthly periods (up until 31 March 2028).  The estimated contract value for the initial period until 31 March 2025 is approximated to be up to Â£60,000 excluding VAT (or Â£72,000 GBP including VAT); and over the full potential term until 31 March 2028, approximated to be up to Â£150,000 excluding VAT; (or Â£180,000 including VAT).
      
      Whilst the appointed provider may be awarded the contract for the full potential contract term, no guarantee can be given regarding the total value of business placed.  
      
      The appointed contractor may therefore be required to supply requirements within the scope of this tender, that are below or in addition to, what has been initially specified within this tender.   The initial contract scope is for venues identified above; which during the overall potential period of contract, may be extended or reduced in line with NML's venue requirements.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Decision House Limited|9 Hampden Road, High Wycombe, Buckinghamshire, United Kingdom, HP136SZ|NONE||No|No]

Organisation Name: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
Title: Children and Young People's Therapeutic Service for Victim Survivors of Domestic Abuse
Description:
The London Borough of Barking & Dagenham (LBBD) requires a children and young people's wellbeing and therapeutic service which is responsive to needs, providing two key elements: 

-	The service should provide an information, advice and guidance service for children and young people to access directly. The service should be easy to access in ways and times that are best for children and young people, ideally identified through consultation and codesign. Guidance is likely to include supporting safety planning with children and young people. 

-	The service should provide counselling and therapeutic support to children and young people who have been victims of domestic abuse/ witnessed the abuse and need help with their emotional wellbeing, and someone to talk to or art therapy, the expectation is that any councillor or therapist who is working directly with the children and young people will have the relevant qualifications. Referrals to this part of the service are likely to be from the children's workforce or parents/carers. Where this is not the case, consent from parents may need to be sought.

Our aim is to better support children and young people who are victims' survivors of domestic abuse by providing them with support at the earliest opportunity possible, where they are able to access the service flexibly out of hours whether this is via a phone line or messaging. Delivery should be age appropriate, and cases escalated where specialist mental health support is required via a referral.

The therapeutic service will provide support to children young people aged 5-18 ensuring the support is suitable based on individual needs and general advice and guidance on their website and over the phone, detailing what services are on offer and available to them, to help with emotional recovery from trauma.  The service will be for children and young people who do not meet the statutory threshold for mental health support.
Additional Text: All tender documents available unrestricted at https://lbbd.bravosolution.co.uk/
Additional Details: All tender documents available unrestricted at https://lbbd.bravosolution.co.uk/

        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.
        Healthwatch Wandsworth along with other Local Healthwatch Services, primary function is to give citizens and communities a stronger voice to influence and challenge how health and social care services are provided. Healthwatch Wandsworth will be at the heart of the local community in Wandsworth, playing a key part in enabling people to be active residents and also help people find the information they need about services in their area. As the independent local people's health and social care champion in the borough, Healthwatch Wandsworth will effectively engage and involve individuals, organisations, professionals and the wider public to facilitate genuine improvements in health and social care services and influence local decisions about health and social care priorities, strategies, and policies.

Title: Sustainable Drainage Technical Support
Description:
East Sussex County Council is the Lead Local Flood Authority for its administrative area. Currently, this means that it is, amongst other things, has a statutory duty to respond to consultations on major planning applications with surface water drainage. (General Development Management Procedure Order 2015 (Schedule 4 Consultations before the grant of permission category ZE)) 

In practice this means that the LLFA comments on the drainage design and local flood risk implications (surface water, ground water and ordinary watercourse) of new development. 

This will include pre-app consultations by developers or Local Planning Authorities (LPAs), consultations on applications for outline, reserved matters, or full planning permission. It also included consultations on the discharge of conditions and any application to vary conditions of a permission. 

We are looking to contract in order to fill two roles:
1.	Drainage Officer
2.	Principal Drainage Officer

The tender will be conducted via the Proactis Procurement Portal - https://supplierlive.proactisp2p.com/Account/Login

[ARDENT CONSULTING ENGINEERS LIMITED|One Alie Street

Notice Identifier: A47 Wansford to Sutton Scheme - Site Clearance
Title: A47 Wansford to Sutton Scheme - Site Clearance
Description:
A47- Wansford to Sutton Scheme
 
Galliford Try, as the East Region Delivery Partner are delivering the A47- Wansford to Sutton Scheme in partnership with Highways England, by upgrading from single carriageway to a D2 dual carriageway. The project will help relieve congestion between Wansford and Sutton, approximately along 2.5km distance, to the west of Peterborough between the existing junction with the A1 and the Nene Way roundabout near Sutton.

The project is forecast to commence on site in March 2023 and will take around 2 years to complete.  

Outline Scope of Works 

Site Clearance - provision of all labour, plant, materials and temporary works as required to provide the subcontract works
The estimate contract amount for this package is expected to be within the following range [ up to Â£160,000]

Programme

It is anticipated that the subcontract works will commence mid - January 2023

Timings

Deadline for Notifications of Interest	16:00 hrs on 25th Nov 2022

Galliford Try Procurement Process

To secure work with Galliford Try, a supplier will need to pass the PAS91 onboarding process administered through Builders Profile. Details will be shared with shortlisted suppliers.
If this package is of interest to your Company, please contact our procurement team by e-mail via the following email address HE012-A47WAN-Commercial@4projectsmail.com , by the above deadline with your notification of interest and details of your capabilities.

Any notifications of interest after the above deadline will not receive a response.

              The procurement documents are available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/tenders/UK-UK-Birmignham:-Research-and-development-services-and-related-consultancy-services./7A7Z8FY8QG

        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.
        This Dynamic purchasing system (DPS) is for the Provision of specialist consultancy services with the main areas of services being as follows:
        
        Lot 1 - Proposal writers capable of pulling together bid proposals to submit to funding agencies working in partnership with the RIE and Academic team.
        
        Lot 2 - Technical specialists and consultants in thematic areas who are capable of providing detailed guidance and specific partnering to underpin the thinking of strategic projects, initiatives, and potential funding proposals. Themes will include, but not be limited to, sustainable futures, digital, creativity, design and innovation, health and quality of life, economic development, and partnership development.
        
        Lot 3 - Intellectual Property specialists who can support the development of commercialisation guidance relating to intellectual property.
        
        Lot 4 - Combined Service providers capable of providing all of the services across Lots 1 and 2.

        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.
        This Dynamic purchasing system (DPS) is for the Provision of specialist consultancy services with the main areas of services being as follows:
        
        Lot 1 - Proposal writers capable of pulling together bid proposals to submit to funding agencies working in partnership with the RIE and Academic team.
        
        Lot 2 - Technical specialists and consultants in thematic areas who are capable of providing detailed guidance and specific partnering to underpin the thinking of strategic projects, initiatives, and potential funding proposals. Themes will include, but not be limited to, sustainable futures, digital, creativity, design and innovation, health and quality of life, economic development, and partnership development.
        
        Lot 3 - Intellectual Property specialists who can support the development of commercialisation guidance relating to intellectual property.
        
        Lot 4 - Combined Service providers capable of providing all of the services across Lots 1 and 2.

Title: Natural England - East Dartmoor NNR Design and construction of a replacement dam at Yarner Wood
Description:
Enter into a Design and Build contract with Mott MacDonald (under the Defra framework) to construct a large box culvert and track way to replace a section of the leaking dam wall at Yarner Wood. The contract would incorporate 1) Project Management (incl. CDM) and Professional Services throughout the scheme, and 2) scoping, investigations and design (incl. permissions, consents).

 Year 1 (2016-17) objectives are to complete part 2) above.

 Year 2 (2017-18) objectives are complete construction and any necessary post-construction evaluation and monitoring

Title: New Substation and Associated Civil Works
Description:
New substation and associated civil works at land adjacent to Queen Street South, Huddersfield
      
      The works comprise the construction of a new 7.5MW HV substation for the University of Huddersfield, including the installation of all associated switchgear, and a civils package to undertake trench work and high voltage cable infrastructure around the campus to existing buildings. The contractor is also responsible for appointing Northern Powergrid for the option 2 'non-contestable works' under this project.

Title: 3412.PS.LWM.22 - External Audit Services for Research Grants for The University of Sheffield
Description:
The University of Sheffield requires External Audit service providers in compliance with the funder requirements for research grant agreements.

The Audit Services shall be divided into two lots:

- Lot 1 - External audit services for European H2020 research grants for The University of Sheffield.
- Lot 2 - External audit services for UK Government funded research grants for The University of Sheffield. (UKRI, Innovate, BEIS (Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy) for example).

The University is looking to appoint a provider of audit services with experience of auditing research funded projects. The successful provider will demonstrate that they have the experience, approach and tools for the provision of audit.

In the final year of the contract the Service Provider will be retained beyond the termination date to complete any ongoing project audits until the reports are submitted to the funder. 

The University welcomes bidders who wish to be considered for one or both lots (provided that they meet the specification criteria).

Tender Process and Documentation:
This is an FTS Open tender exercise. The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/Sheffield
If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender, they must be submitted via the In-tend System.
Your tender response must also be submitted through InTend to arrive by the date and time specified. Late tenders will not be considered.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Hebblethwaites|2 Westbrook Court, Sharrow Vale Road, Sheffield, S11 8YZ|NONE_PARTNERSHIP||Yes|No][KPMG LLP|1 St Peters Square, Manchester M2 3AE|COMPANIES_HOUSE|OC301540|No|No]

Title: Reinforced Autoclaved Aerated Concrete Surveys to Cumberland Council Schools
Description:
The purpose of this commission is to carry out inspection surveys at Cumbria School properties to ascertain and record the following information:\r
â€¢ Do the buildings contain roof structures that have been constructed using Reinforced Aerated Autoclaved Concrete (RAAC) planks? *\r
â€¢ Where RAAC planks are identified, the Council requires the detail of the locations (detailed and marked on a site plan) as well as a synopsis of the current condition, and high-level proposal of how they be managed in the future.\r
*Where the roof structure is not immediately visible on the first visit, the consultant will be required to provide the necessary temporary access equipment and a contractor, if required to 'open up' areas of ceilings within the properties to facilitate the inspection.

Notice Identifier: Future High Streets Fund - Heanor Market Place
Title: Alteration and Refurbishment of Heanor Market Place
Description:
Amber Valley Borough Council seeks expressions of interest from suitable construction and civil engineering companies for the redevelopment of Heanor Market Square, Heanor, Derbyshire, DE75 7AA
 
Within their expression of interest companies will demonstrate suitable experience of public realm works and demonstrate successful completion of contracts
 
To illustrate these works schemed drawing are included as attachments including  
â€¢Scheme drawing
â€¢Topographical survey
â€¢Buried services 
â€¢Building survey
 
Briefly the proposed works include,
â€¢Adjusted kerbs to highway junctions
â€¢Adjusted kerb line to bus stop
â€¢New carpark entrance and exit
â€¢Raise highway level to 'Market Place' 
â€¢Changes to parking and loading bays
â€¢Existing block paved areas replaced with new
â€¢New planting beds
â€¢Drainage revised
â€¢Control of entry to the market, by drop bollards
â€¢New pedestrian scale and feature lighting within pedestrian areas and car park 
â€¢New street furniture throughout 
â€¢New power and water points to serve markets and events
â€¢Existing toilets refurbished
 
Accompanying information.
 
Amber Valley Borough Council would like to receive representation from suitable companies, for consideration please supply the following information.
 
1.	Portfolio works including similar public realm works, including, contract value, program outcomes, and client / management reference for the project.

2.	Short narrative for your proposed management proposals for the site at Heanor, if successful at tender how do you envisage you would manage the works, including, 
a.	Proposed management structure, 
b.	Proposals for managing material deliveries into a public area, 
c.	Site security 
d.	Managing conflicting requirements of businesses fronting the square and people using the market during the working week and at weekends 
e.	Maintenance of public services e.g. bus service?

3.	Preliminary review of the proposed site program at Heanor Market Square, this should include the overall contract program duration but also strategies for phasing works to minimize disruption and works for specific areas of the site and should consider, for example, phasing of the works, to
a.	Potentially bring the carpark back into use early to maintain council revenues on the site,
b.	Manage the works to minimize disruption to business users on the market.
c.	Bringing facilities back into use with minimal disruption e.g. public toilets
 
Instruction for contractors
Expressions of interest should be returned to the email address supplied.
 
These should be received no later than 17th February 2023
 
Contractors supplying details will receive a link to the public portal holding the tender documentation in line with the timescales supplied. (supplied dates may be subject  to change)

â€¢Note - access to the portal and the information may require prior registration.

â€¢Note - the preparation and submission of information is at the contractors risk and all costs incurred are borne by the contractor.
Contact Address 1: Town Hall, Market Place, Ripley East
Attachments: PWP 639 003 General Arrangement Plan P00 (1).pdf 21822-21-01 Topographical REV A.pdf 21822-21-03 Floor Plans.pdf 21822-21-03 Elevations & Section.pdf 21822-21-04-Utility.pdf
text:
Alteration and Refurbishment of Heanor Market Place Amber Valley Borough Council seeks expressions of interest from suitable construction and civil engineering companies for the redevelopment of Heanor Market Square, Heanor, Derbyshire, DE75 7AA
 
Within their expression of interest companies will demonstrate suitable experience of public realm works and demonstrate successful completion of contracts
 
To illustrate these works schemed drawing are included as attachments including  
â€¢Scheme drawing
â€¢Topographical survey
â€¢Buried services 
â€¢Building survey
 
Briefly the proposed works include,
â€¢Adjusted kerbs to highway junctions
â€¢Adjusted kerb line to bus stop
â€¢New carpark entrance and exit
â€¢Raise highway level to 'Market Place' 
â€¢Changes to parking and loading bays
â€¢Existing block paved areas replaced with new
â€¢New planting beds
â€¢Drainage revised
â€¢Control of entry to the market, by drop bollards
â€¢New pedestrian scale and feature lighting within pedestrian areas and car park 
â€¢New street furniture throughout 
â€¢New power and water points to serve markets and events
â€¢Existing toilets refurbished
 
Accompanying information.
 
Amber Valley Borough Council would like to receive representation from suitable companies, for consideration please supply the following information.
 
1.	Portfolio works including similar public realm works, including, contract value, program outcomes, and client / management reference for the project.

2.	Short narrative for your proposed management proposals for the site at Heanor, if successful at tender how do you envisage you would manage the works, including, 
a.	Proposed management structure, 
b.	Proposals for managing material deliveries into a public area, 
c.	Site security 
d.	Managing conflicting requirements of businesses fronting the square and people using the market during the working week and at weekends 
e.	Maintenance of public services e.g. bus service?

3.	Preliminary review of the proposed site program at Heanor Market Square, this should include the overall contract program duration but also strategies for phasing works to minimize disruption and works for specific areas of the site and should consider, for example, phasing of the works, to
a.	Potentially bring the carpark back into use early to maintain council revenues on the site,
b.	Manage the works to minimize disruption to business users on the market.
c.	Bringing facilities back into use with minimal disruption e.g. public toilets
 
Instruction for contractors
Expressions of interest should be returned to the email address supplied.
 
These should be received no later than 17th February 2023
 
Contractors supplying details will receive a link to the public portal holding the tender documentation in line with the timescales supplied. (supplied dates may be subject  to change)

â€¢Note - access to the portal and the information may require prior registration.

â€¢Note - the preparation and submission of information is at the contractors risk and all costs incurred are borne by the contractor.

Notice Identifier: LTMN - Ludham & Potter Heigham Marshes NNR 2023
Title: Long Term Monitoring Network - vegetation survey - Ludham & Potter Heigham Marshes NNR - 2023
Description: For Natural England's Long Term Monitoring Network project, at Ludham & Potter Heigham Marshes NNR, 2023. A vegetation survey comprising recording of plant species presence and cover, and other attributes, in 50 no. 2m2 permanent monitoring plots across the site. Preparation work includes relocating the permanent plot markers - feno markers - and re-recording the exact location using high-accuracy gps. The collected data is provided on an Excel template and quality assured, with a short summary report.

Title: Highways England Vehicle Recovery Contract (2020 - 2027)
Description: This renewal contract is primarily to provide Highways England with a statutory removal service for the removal of accident damaged, broken down or abandoned vehicles from the strategic road network (SRN) in England. Removals are focused on those parts of the strategic road network patrolled by the Traffic Officer Service, who have the powers sanctioned within the Removal and Disposal of Vehicles (Traffic Officers) (England) Regulations 2008 to effect statutory removals. The appointed contractor will be responsible for the recovery of statutory charges for Highways England from those vehicles removed in accordance with the Removal, Storage and Disposal of Vehicles (Prescribed Sums and Charges) Regulations 2008. Highways England will use income recovered from statutory charges (less a deduction to fund its own internal administration costs) to pay the appointed contractor, so that this statutory removal service is self-funding. It is envisaged that the volume of removals could be around 15,000 vehicles per annum. . This contract will also allow Highways England to pre-position recovery vehicles for operation as required to enhance the carriageway clearance abilities of the Traffic Officer Service (TOS). Highways England will fund such pre-positioning and clearance service on an 'as required' basis (this fee is not recoverable via the statutory removal scheme).
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West
Attachments: FMG - Notification of Award_Redacted.pdf Highways England Vehicle Recovery Contract Data Issue 1.pdf Highways_England_Vehicle_Recovery_Form_of_Agreement_(Issue_2)_-_Signed_by_FMG_Redacted.pdf Vehicle Recovery Scope 1 Statutory Vehicle Removal_Redacted.pdf Vehicle Recovery Scope 2 Pre-Positioning_Redacted.pdf Vehicle Recovery Scope 3 Scheme Removal_Redacted.pdf

The appointed contractor will be responsible for the recovery of statutory charges for Highways England from those vehicles removed in accordance with the Removal, Storage and Disposal of Vehicles (Prescribed Sums and Charges) Regulations 2008. Highways England will use income recovered from statutory charges (less a deduction to fund its own internal administration costs) to pay the appointed contractor, so that this statutory removal service is self-funding. Title: Supply Chain Notice: Penstock Refurbishments and Replacements Programme across Portsmouth Naval Base
Description:
Project location
HM Naval Base Portsmouth 

The Contractor shall be expected to adhere by the HMNB site security requirements, all Contractors and Sub-Contractors shall be BPSS security vetted and will be required to hold the relevant site security passes.
The Contractor shall be expected to hold the following levels of insurance Â£10m Public Liability, Â£10m Product Liability, Â£5m Professional Indemnity.

KBS Maritime - Introduction
KBS Maritime is a joint venture between KBR and BAE Systems, bringing together two global players with a rich heritage of delivering excellence, innovation and reliability. The joint venture will combine the expertise of KBR as a global leader in infrastructure asset management and services with BAE Systems' experience and capability within Portsmouth Naval Base. KBS Maritime are delivering an ambitious, modern and enduring change to the Portsmouth Naval base infrastructure, securing investment in the local community and ensuring fit-for-purpose, world-leading fleet support for the Royal Navy and the UK in the decades ahead.

Project Background
KBS Maritime have a requirement for penstock refurbishments and replacements across Portsmouth Naval Base. The penstock system controls sea water via a culvert system between the harbour, the basin and the dry docks. These include levelling penstocks of circa 8 metres deep to drainage penstocks circa 22 metres deep. The refurbishment programme covers door seals, shaft and door nut replacements, ladder and platform replacements and actuation upgrades. The replacement programme will replace the current cast irons doors with a steel version specification to be agreed along with the associated shafts, wedges, door nut, brackets, platforms, ladders and actuation and road plates.  This is a rolling 10 year programme with two refurbishments to be complete by end of 2023 and circa seven replacements by end of 2024.

Key Dates (approximate)
- Expressions of Interest: 16 June
- PQQ Evaluation: 14 Jul
- Bidders Selected: 28 Jul
- ITT Published: 4 Aug
- ITT Close: 8 Sept
- Construction commencement: 9 Oct
- Construction Completion 22 Dec

Approx Contract Values: Refurbishment up to Â£1m; Penstock Replacement: Â£2m to  > Â£5m

KBS Works Contract will be applicable to this project (this will be made available at ITT stage)
Additional Text:
:  If you are interested in this opportunity, please contact KBS Maritime at Tenders@kbsmaritime.com quoting ref: EOI- Penstock Refurbishments and Replacements Programme across Portsmouth Naval Base in the email subject title to express interest. 

Once the notice has closed, suppliers will be invited to Pre-Qualify and/or Invited to Tender. Open or restricted tender procedure will be dependent on the number of expression of interest received.

Title: Provision of Passive Fire Protection
Description:
The Contractor will be requested to provide the Employer with Passive Fire Safety works / services including but not limited to the following areas:
â€¢ Compartmentalise a building through use of fire-resistance rated walls and floors, keeping the fire from spreading quickly and providing time to escape for people in the building.
â€¢ Fire Doors help compartmentalize a building, while giving its occupants means of escape.
â€¢ Fire Walls and Floors to separate the building into compartments to stop the spread of fire/smoke from room to room.
â€¢ Fire Compartmentalisation including fire stopping replacement, supply, and installation of the above.
â€¢ Remedial works ordered from Fire Risk Assessment report recommendations.

 The Employer requires the use of third-party certified products which have been independently certified by a UKAS accredited organisation.
This provides the following required layers of protection.
â€¢ A manufacturers declaration of performance.
â€¢ An original test report.
â€¢ An effective quality management system in the factory to ensure quality of manufacture.
â€¢ A regular and independent third-party factory audit.
â€¢ Product support identification.
â€¢ Random audit and testing in a furnace
â€¢ Detailed parameters of usage.
â€¢ Control of cascaded evidence.
â€¢ Standardised installation and maintenance information.
â€¢ Full traceability via permanent labelling or markings.
The Employer requires third party accredited and competent installers to ensure that the tested and approved materials are competently installed in accordance with manufacturers test evidence and documentation.
The third-party certified Contractors will be required to label and verify the installations specification and prove conformance.
Regarding fire door installations the Contractor is required to be a member of a relevant fire door installation certification scheme such as FIRAS/BM TRADA. (Other schemes are available). New fire door installations require certification to prove manufacturers and installation conformance. It i

Title: Innovate UK KTN - exhibition stand design and build
Description:
Innovate UK KTN exists to connect innovators with new partners and new opportunities beyond their existing thinking - accelerating ambitious ideas into real-world solutions. 

Innovate UK KTN is looking to appoint a suitably qualified exhibition design company to design, manufacture install and derig an exhibition stand for the Innovation Zero Congress (https://www.innovationzero.com/welcome-to-innovation-zero) on 24-25 May in Olympia, London. 

We expect to work closely with the chosen company to develop and realise the stand in a creative, eco-conscious and impactful way that is relevant and accessible to our audiences. 

Innovate UK is organising a cross-government stand with representatives from multiple organisations. Innovate UK KTN will be leading on the design and build and management of the stand. 

This is a two-day, b2b clean tech congress which aims to accelerate business action towards Net Zero commitments. There are two spaces of 72sqm (6x12m) each.  The attached floor plan shows the current exhibition layout. There is a main gangway between the two spaces.  

The spaces should meet the objectives outlined below, appeal to the specific target audiences and meet our requirements for brand visibility. 
The objectives of the stand are to: 
â€¢	Showcase Innovate UK - the UK's innovation agency
â€¢	Put the agencies involved at the heart of the race to achieve Net Zero
â€¢	Create an audience experience which encourages engagement and interaction
â€¢	Create a stand-journey that furthers the audience's understanding of the different agencies and their contribution to the race for Net Zero
â€¢	Deliver a clear vision of all Innovate UK services
â€¢	Showcase how Innovate UK supports innovation via live demonstrations/exhibits

The theme for the stand will be worked on with the chosen supplier but as a guide should include: 
â€¢	Net Zero - a future of opportunity
â€¢	Creating a better future by investing in innovation

This will be an opportunity for significant brand positioning and awareness for Innovate UK and display of its brand must be a primary consideration.  

Following sign-off of detailed designs, the agency will undertake production design and specification of all exhibition elements. The materials selected should demonstrate best-practice in Net Zero and sustainability and consider reuse or recycling. The build must be durable and easy to clean. The structures must be compliant with relevant statutory and non-statutory requirements e.g. Health & Safety regulations, Equality Act legislation, be constructed of fire retardant materials and follow best practice procedures. 

All rights (including ownership and copyright) will pass to Innovate UK KTN on completion of this project. 

Please apply to aileen.woodley@iuk.ktn-uk.org with your company details, experience of similar sized design and build contracts, confirmation of availability for the project, suggestions of materials to ensure we adhere to Net Zero best practice and a timeline.
Attachments: Stand brief, Innovation Zero.docx Innovation Zero Floorplan (Jan 23) Olympia 24-25 May Innovate UK stand (2) (1).pdf

Title: Facilitator for people with lived experience of care
Description:
The Department wishes to appoint a facilitator to co-create with the department 
sessions to engage with those with lived experience of the care system. We are 
looking for a bidder who understands and has previous experience of the workings of 
children's social care and in particular those with lived experience of the care 
system. 
This post is an essential role in implementing the new children's social care reforms. 
The post-holder will work with their charity counterparts, virtually or face-to-face, to 
facilitate and run effective, inclusive sessions and engagement with people with lived 
experience of the care system, to support them to feed in views and influence 
implementation of reforms. Each session will have a specific focus on various 
aspects of the reform implementation- to be confirmed in partnership with the DfE. 
The initial contract duration is 12 months to align with the proposed consultation 
periods.
The estimated budget for this contract is Â£25,000 and we will conduct a 3 quote exercise.
Attachments: Barnardos Contract - Redacted.pdf
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Barnardo's|Barnardo House, Tanners Lane,  Barkingside, Ilford, Essex, IG6 1QG|NONE_OTHER||No|Yes]

Title: IA2478 - Contract for the appointment of a multi-disciplinary team for design & delivery of a proposed Mixed-use development at the Former M&S Store site at 32 Gaolgate Street, Stafford ST16 2NT
Description:
Appointment of a multi-disciplinary team for design and delivery of proposed mixed-use development at the Former M&S Store site, 32 Gaolgate Street, Stafford ST16 2NT
      
This procurement is focused on the re-development of the Former M&S Store at Gaolgate Street to provide a new mixed-use development offering an attractive setting for town centre residential living. This will be complimented with easy access to shops, urban market pods, food & beverage units and a gymnasium; all flanked along a vibrant pedestrian thoroughfare route between the existing Stafford Bus Station and Gaolgate Street, improving connectivity on the high street.
      
Staffordshire County Council are procuring this on behalf of Stafford Borough Council

Title: CFEAS22-101 Contract for the provision of pilot surveys using Remote Piloted Aircraft (RPA) of beach locations in Belize
Description:
The Ocean Country Partnership Programme (OCPP) was announced in 2021 as a key bilateral aid programme under the Blue Planet Fund. The UK is working in partnership with Belize and at least five other countries to deliver marine science technical assistance across the 3 core themes of marine pollution, biodiversity loss and supporting sustainable seafood.

A flagship of the OCPP science and innovation is the cross-country Artificial Intelligence (AI) Environmental Monitoring work package. This work package supports partner countries with developing automated data collection, analysis and reporting on marine pollution to reduce costs and increase efficiencies of increased demands to monitor the marine environment. Cefas is leading the development of an innovative end-to-end machine learning solution to automate the process of monitoring, analysing and reporting marine litter. The tool will support streamlining of decision making for action and policy decision through bespoke automated reporting. Cefas will partner with host nations to co-develop and apply the tool in the host nation. At the core of the project is knowledge and expertise transfer to develop capacity for the long-term sustainable application of tools and methods.

To support the outputs, Cefas wishes to work with experienced stakeholders and organisations in Belize and are looking for an organisation with extensive knowledge and experience in gathering high resolution Remotely Piloted Aircraft (RPA - hence forward referred to as a "drone(s)") imagery of coastal and beach environments in Belize at a quality that will be sufficient to clearly identify a cigarette butt in raw imagery.
Attachments: CEFAS22-101_Short_Form_Contract_CZMAI_signed - redacted.pdf
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Coastal Zone Management Authority and Institute|Princess Margaret Drive, Belize City, Belize|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: SL HAWTT Programme Stage 1- Tranche 1
Description:
Sellafield Ltd has awarded contracts to support the delivery of Stage 1 of Tranche 1 of our Highly Active Waste Thermal Treatment Programme (HAWATT Programme) to the two suppliers identified within this notice on the basis that the suppliers have a thermal treatment technology capable of supporting the HAWATT Programme and to which the supplier has exclusive rights.    
The purpose of the Stage 1 contract awards is to enable Sellafield Ltd to determine whether the proprietary  technology solutions of the suppliers meet baseline requirements for pilot facilities which will be delivered by the HAWATT Programme.  Sellafield Ltd has elected to award contracts to both suppliers to ensure that there is no unnecessary narrowing of parameters.  Should Sellafield Ltd be satisfied that the baseline requirements are met then Sellafield Ltd may subsequently award a supplies contract , in accordance with Regulations 32(5)(a) of the Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

Title: North Northamptonshire Council - Nightly Purchased, Supplier Managed Temporary Accommodation
Description:
North Northamptonshire Council (hereafter referred to as the "Council") wishes to invite Tender Responses for the supply of Nightly Purchased, Supplier Managed Temporary Accommodation services in North Northamptonshire.

The Council is setting up a DPS for Nightly Purchased, Supplier Managed Temporary Accommodation Services. The award of the contract will be for an initial 36 months, with an option to extend for a further 12 months, making 48 months in total.

Through a temporary accommodation service improvement project, in the short term the Council remains focussed on four main aims related to temporary accommodation use:

- Reducing the use of bed and breakfast / hotel accommodation
- Keeping the number of temporary accommodation placements outside of North Northamptonshire as close to zero as possible
- Improving the standards of nightly paid supplier managed temporary accommodation
- Maximising income from both council-owned and nightly paid temporary accommodation

Please visit the North Northamptonshire Council e-Procurement Portal (https://in-tendhost.co.uk/nnc/aspx/Home) to express an interest in this opportunity and to access the tender documentation.

The light touch regime (LTR) applies to the Services under this DPS, as per Public Contracts Regulations 2015.

Title: GBC RH Guildford Park Re-Development - Design and Construction of new Multi-Storey Car Park - AWARD
Description:
Guildford Borough Council (the Council) is redeveloping the existing surface car park at Guildford Park Road to provide new residential accommodation, a new Multi-Storey Car Park (MSCP) and associated infrastructure.
      
      The Council has obtained planning consent for the entire scheme (Ref 16/P/01270). Details of the permitted development are as follows:
      
      Redevelopment of the site to provide 160 residential apartments and houses (Use Class C3) with new infrastructure, parking, access, landscaping, cycle storage and associated facilities including private and communal amenity space together with a five storey 541 space multi-storey public car park (Sui Generis) and 825 sqm. (GEFA) flexible commercial floorspace (Use Class A1, B1 and D2) on the ground floor of the multi-storey car park.
      
      The scope of this procurement exercise is the design and construction of the MSCP, associated infrastructure (including construction of new sub-station) and public realm works.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Morgan Sindall Construction and Infrastruture Ltd|1650 Parkway, Solent Business Park   , Fareham, United Kingdom,  P015 7AH|NONE||No|No]
text:
GBC RH Guildford Park Re-Development - Design and Construction of new Multi-Storey Car Park - AWARD Guildford Borough Council (the Council) is redeveloping the existing surface car park at Guildford Park Road to provide new residential accommodation, a new Multi-Storey Car Park (MSCP) and associated infrastructure.
      
      The Council has obtained planning consent for the entire scheme (Ref 16/P/01270). Details of the permitted development are as follows:
      
      Redevelopment of the site to provide 160 residential apartments and houses (Use Class C3) with new infrastructure, parking, access, landscaping, cycle storage and associated facilities including private and communal amenity space together with a five storey 541 space multi-storey public car park (Sui Generis) and 825 sqm. (GEFA) flexible commercial floorspace (Use Class A1, B1 and D2) on the ground floor of the multi-storey car park.
      
      The scope of this procurement exercise is the design and construction of the MSCP, associated infrastructure (including construction of new sub-station) and public realm works.

Title: Bridgewell Supported Living Residential accommodation Project
Description:
Bracknell Forest Council ("the Council") are seeking to develop accommodation and support for an ageing population of people with learning disabilities, built around demand, need and best practice and informed by the market and community. The site is located at 10 Ladybank, Bracknell RG12 7HA off Birch Hill Road and is situated close to a medical practice, shops, community centre and a primary school.
The site is accessed via Ladybank Road, a no-through road. The surrounding area is predominantly residential. Temporary access for construction may also be possible from Leppington Road (north of the site), subject to seeking Highways consent.
Part of the site slopes from west to east, with the existing building situated on a levelled surface. The proposed new building is planned to remain around the same level of the existing building. For further details, please refer to the IBI architect's RIBA Stage 2 report.
The Bridgewell Supported Living project will provide four 5-bedroom units and is based on a two-storey new build accommodation, i.e. the existing building will be demolished. The scheme will achieve BREEAM Excellent sustainability and secure by design rating. The design is based on Housing our Ageing Population Panel for Innovation (HAPPI).
In summary, the works involve the following: -
1)	Complete RIBA Stages 3 and 4 design under a PCSA. 
2)	Site perimeter hoarding.
3)	Isolation and capping of existing services.
4)	Asbestos removal.
5)	Soft strip.
6)	Full demolition of the existing buildings on site and adjust levels to the site.
7)	Construction of a new two storey supported living residential accommodation with a roof garden. BREEAM Excellent target.
8)	Landscaping works including access, car parking, pedestrian routes, garden & planting works and making good. 
9)	Adjustment of hoardings and boundary.

This project will be developed under a Design and Build (D&B) process i.e. the contract sum for the Main Works Contract (the "Contract Sum") will be arrived at in two stages. The intention is that the selected Contractor will initially fulfil the design for RIBA stages 3 and 4 under a Pre-Construction Services Agreement and ultimately be appointed under a lump sum form of contract (JCT Design and Build 2016 as amended by The Schedule of Amendments) (the "Main Works Contract").  A summary of this process is set out in the Combined Invitation to Tender. 
Organisations must register their interest on the South East Business Portal site in order to receive any changes or notifications issued by the Council during this tender process. The Council will not be held responsible for lack of communication to any organisation who does not register their interest. Clarification questions can also be submitted through the messaging facility on  this site.
Additional Text:
Economic and Financial Standing. The authority will seek more information from independent credit agencies as part of the evaluation and reserves the right to undertake credit checks at each stage of the procurement process and after contract award.

The council reserves the right not to award the contract in whole or in part, to cancel or amend the tender process and does not bind itself to accept any tender.  The Council shall not be liable under any circumstances for any costs or expenses incurred by any bidder or prospective bidder in responding to this notice or in taking part in this procurement process.

Bidders are advised to allow adequate time for uploading documents and to dispatch the electronic response well in advance of the closing time to avoid any last minute problems.

Title: SC220274 - Treasury Advisor (1)
Description:
The Council manages investments of some Â£500m and a debt portfolio of circa Â£800m.\r
These are substantial sums of money and KCC is therefore exposed to significant financial\r
risks including the loss of invested funds and the revenue effect of changing interest rates.\r
KCC's strategic objective is to control and monitor these risks and minimize their impact on\r
its revenue budget. The role of the treasury advisor is seen as being key to the Council\r
achieving its objective.\r
\r
KCC is therefore seeking to appoint a treasury advisor to provide advice and guidance on its\r
treasury management and investment strategy. The services provided must include\r
investment advice and not just the provision of information. The Council will rely on the\r
advice and information provided in making its own independent decisions on its treasury\r
management and investment activities.\r
\r
These services supplement the Council's in-house capacity to take treasury management\r
decisions with specialist treasury management advice enriched by high frequency contact\r
with relevant financial institutions and their regulators and frequent consideration of a wide\r
range of relevant sources of information and analysis relevant to the formation of such\r
advice.\r
\r
Tenderers must demonstrate that they can deliver the above service specification by explaining how they would deliver each aspect of the service within each of the following sections below. Tenderers must make sure that they fully explain how the service would be delivered. Anything that is not directly relevant should not be included. Wherever possible tenderers should demonstrate how they will go further than what is being asked for, to add value.\r
\r
Candidates who wish to be considered for this opportunity are initially required to submit a Selection Questionnaire via the Kent Business Portal no later than 23rd January 2023. Documentation will be automatically issued on expression of interest on the Kent Business Portal. \r
Region: North East,North West,Yorkshire and The Humber,East Midlands,West Midlands,East of England,London,South East,South West,Scotland,Wales,Northern Ireland

Title: GB-Bristol-Contract Notice - FMSP Soft Facilities Management - Portsmouth
Description:
Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: II.!.9
        Instead of: Variants will be accepted - no
        Read: Please note that potential suppliers should ignore any indication at II.1.9 of this notice that variant bids are not permitted.  The ITN currently under development may make provision for the submission of variant bids
        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.The Future Maritime Support Programme (FMSP) will underpin the success of the Royal Navy (RN) in supporting the Royal Navy's Complex Warships, Submarines and Naval Bases, by providing all:
        â€¢	Surface ships and submarine engineering support services;
        â€¢	Submarine deep maintenance;
        â€¢	Facilities management and other naval base services; and
        â€¢	Maritime logistics services. 
        at the HM Naval Bases and associated Dockyards at Devonport, Clyde, Rosyth and Portsmouth. 
        
        In 2014, the Authority placed two contracts with industrial partners, Babcock Marine (BM) and BAE Systems (BAES) for Naval Base, Ship, and Submarine outputs. These contracts form the Maritime Support Delivery Framework (MSDF) and are due to expire on 31 March 2020.  
        Recognising the success of both MSDF, and its predecessor the Warship Support Modernisation Initiative (WSMI), in supporting the RN, after nearly 20 years it is timely for the Authority to review its current Naval Base services solution. The FMSP is the result of this review.
        
        The FMSP is a programme of work that will succeed and improve upon the MSDF contracts currently in place, commencing on 1 April 2020.  FMSP will deliver additional transformational change, cost reductions (in the target of 30%) and an improved service for the RN. 
        
        The contracting Authority considers that economic operators who are small or medium enterprises (SME's) could participate in this contract individually or through the partnership/collaboration with other SME's/Suppliers or as part of the Supply Chain to other Suppliers.  The PQQ Supplementary Information on the Competition Site includes a contact list of Suppliers who participated in the FMSP Market Engagement phase which may be of assistance to SME's in this regard. 
        
        Suppliers interested in working with the Ministry of Defence should register on the Authority Supplier Information Database (SID) Register, available at www.contracts.mod.uk. GB-Bristol-Contract Notice - FMSP Soft Facilities Management - Portsmouth Text to be corrected in the original notice:
        Place of text to be modified: II.!.9
        Instead of: Variants will be accepted - no
        Read: Please note that potential suppliers should ignore any indication at II.1.9 of this notice that variant bids are not permitted.  The ITN currently under development may make provision for the submission of variant bids
        Other additional information: The contracting authority considers that this contract may be suitable for economic operators that are small or medium enterprises (SMEs). However, any selection of tenderers will be based solely on the criteria set out for the procurement.The Future Maritime Support Programme (FMSP) will underpin the success of the Royal Navy (RN) in supporting the Royal Navy's Complex Warships, Submarines and Naval Bases, by providing all:
        â€¢	Surface ships and submarine engineering support services;
        â€¢	Submarine deep maintenance;
        â€¢	Facilities management and other naval base services; and
        â€¢	Maritime logistics services. 
        at the HM Naval Bases and associated Dockyards at Devonport, Clyde, Rosyth and Portsmouth. 
        
        In 2014, the Authority placed two contracts with industrial partners, Babcock Marine (BM) and BAE Systems (BAES) for Naval Base, Ship, and Submarine outputs. These contracts form the Maritime Support Delivery Framework (MSDF) and are due to expire on 31 March 2020.  
        Recognising the success of both MSDF, and its predecessor the Warship Support Modernisation Initiative (WSMI), in supporting the RN, after nearly 20 years it is timely for the Authority to review its current Naval Base services solution. The FMSP is the result of this review.
        
        The FMSP is a programme of work that will succeed and improve upon the MSDF contracts currently in place, commencing on 1 April 2020.  FMSP will deliver additional transformational change, cost reductions (in the target of 30%) and an improved service for the RN. 
        
        The contracting Authority considers that economic operators who are small or medium enterprises (SME's) could participate in this contract individually or through the partnership/collaboration with other SME's/Suppliers or as part of the Supply Chain to other Suppliers.  The PQQ Supplementary Information on the Competition Site includes a contact list of Suppliers who participated in the FMSP Market Engagement phase which may be of assistance to SME's in this regard.

Organisation Name: THE NATIONAL MUSEUM OF THE ROYAL NAVY
Title: Purchase of HR & Payroll System and Fully Managed Payroll Service (With Lots)
Description:
The National Museum of the Royal Navy (NMRN) is looking for an efficient HR system and payroll service. The NMRN wishes to procure an integrated HR and payroll System with a fully managed payroll service, or an integrated HR and payroll system that NMRN can manage itself, or a HR system plus a fully managed payroll service. Therefore, the tender comprises of 4 lots that bidders can tender for.

Lot 1- Integrated HR and Payroll System and Fully Managed Payroll Service
Lot 2- Integrated HR and Payroll System Only
Lot 3- Fully Managed Payroll Service Only
Lot 4- HR System Only

All lots will be evaluated as submitted.

Systems are continually evolving and our reporting requirements and accessibility to HR and payroll data are increasing, in particular the ability to export data into other systems, making our processes more efficient. Scalable HR and Payroll systems that are capable of seamless integration are essential to improve the administrative HR and payroll process for the NMRN. 

Costs of the tender will vary depending on which lot(s) are awarded. Full details can be found in the ITT document and also Appendix A - Scope of Requirement/Brief.

Clarification Questions should be directed to tenders@nmrn.org.uk
Contact Address 1: National Museum of the Royal Navy (NMRN)
Attachments: NMRN ITT HR and Payroll System- Annex A-B-C.pdf NMRN ITT HR and Payroll System- Annex D-E-F.pdf NMRN Guidance and FAQs for Suppliers- HR & Payroll.pdf ITT Annex A - Scope of Requirement- Full Brief.pdf New NMRN Service Contract v3.1- Example.pdf NMRN Clarifications and Responses- HR & Payroll System.pdf NMRN Clarifications and Responses- HR  Payroll System Final Issue.pdf

Organisation Name: Department for Environment Food & Rural Affairs
Title: Discovery of recent changes in consumer behaviour around food information
Description:
This opportunity is advertised by Defra group Commercial on behalf of Defra.

The Authority is the UK Government Department responsible for the environment, food, farming and rural affairs (Defra). Further information on the Authority can be found at: https://www.gov.uk/government/organisations/department-for-environment-food-rural-affairs

This document sets out the strategy for procuring the project titled "Discovery of Recent Changes in Consumer Behaviour around Food Information (Food Information to Consumers [FIC])".

In 2011, the European Union (EU) passed Regulation No. 1169/2011 on the provision of Food Information to Consumers (EU FIC Regulation).  This regulation required member states to modify existing food labelling regulations, with the aim of: 

1) Enabling consumers to make more informed choices; 
2) Increasing the safe use of food; and 
3) Ensuring the free movement of legally produced and marketed food, within the EU. 

The Withdrawal Act retained Regulation No. 1169/2011 into UK law.  

In 2014 and 2018, Defra commissioned two studies in succession to establish a baseline against which the effect of changes brought in by the EU FIC Regulation could be tracked and to review the extent of how the objectives of EU FIC have been achieved. 

We are now commissioning new research to provide an update assessing the impact of the FIC regulation and to measure recent changes in consumer behaviour and business activity bought about by recent legislative, societal, and technological changes. The evidence will be used to underpin food labelling policy development.

The procurement documents are available for unrestricted and full direct access, free of charge, at https://defra-family.force.com/s/Welcome Any questions, requests to participate or tender submissions must be submitted electronically via this portal.

Title: SBC CCTV provision, repair and maintenance
Description:
SBC CCTV Provision repair and maintenance services
Swindon Borough Council invites expressions of interest from suitably qualified and experienced service providers for the provision of CCTV covering install repair and maintenance of hardware and software to support the system
SBC has a large spend on CCTV Camera purchase repair and maintenance Much of the spend is off contract with the majority being spent with one company the current spend annually is in the region of 225 000 covering new purchases maintenance and repairs of cameras and equipment this spend cannot be guaranteed for every year of the contract This spend is a mixture of goods and services but places the organisation in an area of risk under current procurement legislation
The purpose of this tender is to centralise the control of the CCTV spend with the Security Team with an agreed supplier through a tender process This aligned with a CCTV policy being prepared will  also enable tighter control of CCTV paperwork reducing the chance of data breaches and ensuring compliance with GDPR requirement

The purpose of this tender is to centralise the control of the CCTV spend with the Security Team with an agreed supplier through a tender process This aligned with a CCTV policy being prepared will  also enable tighter control of CCTV paperwork reducing the chance of data breaches and ensuring compliance with GDPR requirement

Title: Combined Heat and Power (CHP) Installation Provider - Pre-Qualification Questionnaire
Description:
CENTRICA DISTRIBUTED ENERGY & POWER (DE&P) CORNWALL LOCAL ENERGY MARKET PROJECT

No. LEM006c - Combined Heat and Power (CHP) Installation Provider - Pre-Qualification Questionnaire

Overview: Centrica plc's Cornwall Local Energy Market Programme has a requirement for a suitably experienced, capable and proven EPC contractor that will undertake all necessary components of a CHP project from systems design through to commissioning and certification. It is anticipated that there will be between two and five sites for CHP Systems and associated boiler refurbishment works in Cornwall that will be realised through this procurement process. Each CHP system will comprise one or more natural gas fuelled, reciprocating engine CHP units, ranging from 35 kWe up to a possible 2.5 MWe.

Centrica plc's Cornwall Local Energy Market Programme (LEM) is an EU funded pioneering initiative involving the development of a virtual marketplace. The trial provides participants (homes and businesses) with a platform to buy and sell energy and flexibility to both the supply networks and the wholesale energy market. 

The Â£19M, three-year trial is being delivered in partnership with the local distribution network operator Western Power Distribution, alongside National Grid, University of Exeter, Imperial College London and other partners. It is being funded by Centrica and the British Gas Energy for Tomorrow Fund alongside a Â£13M grant from the European Regional Development Fund.

The full technical specification and pre-qualification details are in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request. 

2.	What is required from Applicants?

Applicants will need to complete the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire and HSE Questionnaire.

Full details of the PQQ requirements are available in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request.

3.	How the Successful Candidates will be Chosen

PQQ responses will be evaluated using weighted scoring criteria, taking into account commercial and technical considerations. 

Full details can be found in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request.

Successful candidates from the PQQ process will then be invited to take part in the ITT process.

4.	Deadline and How to Apply

Deadline for Questions: Monday 4 December 2017 12:00
Deadline for return of PQQ: Wednesday 6 December 2017 at 12:00 GMT

In the first instance, to register interest and to request a PQQ document pack please contact: 

Owen Jones
Chartered Energy Manager
JRP Solutions
owen.jones@jrpsolutions.com

Parties wishing to respond must submit their questionnaires, by Wednesday 6th December 2017 at 12:00 GMT, to:

Owen Jones
Chartered Energy Manager
JRP Solutions
owen.jones@jrpsolutions.com

Questions regarding this PQQ should be lodged with:  Owen Jones 
Note that answers to all questions will be sent to all candidates.

Please include 'LEM006c' in the subject line of all emails.

Contact with Centrica staff during the procurement process is strictly prohibited.

No. LEM006c - Combined Heat and Power (CHP) Installation Provider - Pre-Qualification Questionnaire

Overview: Centrica plc's Cornwall Local Energy Market Programme has a requirement for a suitably experienced, capable and proven EPC contractor that will undertake all necessary components of a CHP project from systems design through to commissioning and certification. It is anticipated that there will be between two and five sites for CHP Systems and associated boiler refurbishment works in Cornwall that will be realised through this procurement process. Each CHP system will comprise one or more natural gas fuelled, reciprocating engine CHP units, ranging from 35 kWe up to a possible 2.5 MWe.

Centrica plc's Cornwall Local Energy Market Programme (LEM) is an EU funded pioneering initiative involving the development of a virtual marketplace. The trial provides participants (homes and businesses) with a platform to buy and sell energy and flexibility to both the supply networks and the wholesale energy market. 

The Â£19M, three-year trial is being delivered in partnership with the local distribution network operator Western Power Distribution, alongside National Grid, University of Exeter, Imperial College London and other partners. It is being funded by Centrica and the British Gas Energy for Tomorrow Fund alongside a Â£13M grant from the European Regional Development Fund.

The full technical specification and pre-qualification details are in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request. 

2.	What is required from Applicants?

Applicants will need to complete the Pre-Qualification Questionnaire and HSE Questionnaire.

Full details of the PQQ requirements are available in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request.

3.	How the Successful Candidates will be Chosen

PQQ responses will be evaluated using weighted scoring criteria, taking into account commercial and technical considerations. 

Full details can be found in the PQQ document pack, which is available on request.

Successful candidates from the PQQ process will then be invited to take part in the ITT process.

4.	Deadline and How to Apply

Deadline for Questions: Monday 4 December 2017 12:00
Deadline for return of PQQ: Wednesday 6 December 2017 at 12:00 GMT

In the first instance, to register interest and to request a PQQ document pack please contact: 

Owen Jones
Chartered Energy Manager
JRP Solutions
owen.jones@jrpsolutions.com

Parties wishing to respond must submit their questionnaires, by Wednesday 6th December 2017 at 12:00 GMT, to:

Owen Jones
Chartered Energy Manager
JRP Solutions
owen.jones@jrpsolutions.com

Questions regarding this PQQ should be lodged with:  Owen Jones 
Note that answers to all questions will be sent to all candidates.

Please include 'LEM006c' in the subject line of all emails.

Contact with Centrica staff during the procurement process is strictly prohibited.
